She's recently been on a `me do it!' kick. No more mom stepping in to help with anything, she wants to do it all herself. And I'm actually torn by this. In some ways it's a bit more difficult and takes more time, but in a few weeks I know our world will be completely different and quite possibly much better. And the best thing about all of this is that big brother has taken note and doesn't want to be left behind. So, I'm currently the momma of two potty-training toddlers. Crazy! I blame much of that on this extremely fantastic book!

With bright colors, a cute character and a very funny story little ones learn that there is a better way than pooping in a diaper. There's the Potty! Not only, no more diapers, but big kid underpants with all sorts of fun pictures on them. This is the perfect book for toddlers and even those tough-to-train kiddos. By showing what can sometimes be a whole lot of waiting, but a very `big kid' thing to do, toddlers soon realize this may be something worth trying out. Without a doubt this would be my first recommendation when it comes to potty training books for kiddos. A fun story with a great way to teach little ones basics!

Originally reviewed & copyrighted on my site, There's A Book.
summary: My number one potty training go to book for toddlers!

reviewText: This is a cute book and my 18 mo son loves it. But the language is also pretty vague and in reading the book I have to fill in a lot of blanks. For example, throughout the book it refers to "I have to go" rather than "I have to pee"... Where does he have to go? I have to do a lot of translating that go means pee, and what the meaning of the cat and dog are. It's a nice book but think of it more as a potty-comic than a potty-book.
summary: Cute but needs some additional comments from the reader...

reviewText: My daughter loves this book. It's easy to read/understand and the board pages are a must for my 19mo old. After reading the book, she wants to sit on her potty! The only kinda bad thing is that my daughter thinks the baby looks like a monkey! LOL

I started reading this book to my son when he was around 13 months. I had high hopes to EC him, but I never got around to it.

Last night, after 3 months of reading this book, my 16 month old sat on the potty and had a pee.  I kid you not.  This is my second child, and while my first trained early (night trained by 22 months), I have even higher hopes for my son  BECAUSE OF THIS BOOK.  He literally sat on his potty reading THIS BOOK, pondering what he was doing and what the little baby that looks just like him was doing. It was amazing.

It's a beautiful, funny and helpful potty book for little ones!

Update: my son is now 2. He night trained at 22 months, and has been in undies since 19 months. He rarely has accidents, and is great about taking himself to the potty.  This book helped my son teach himself how to use the potty! I LOVE THIS BOOK. My son literally trained himself before 2, and I know it was greatly due to this brilliant book designed for toddlers.
summary: Fabulous book for ECing or Early start

reviewText:
Bought this for my 18m old.
She enjoys seeing the baby and the animals.

I found it lacking. It spent so much time addressing if the kid wanted to use the potty that it doesn't really talk about what happens afterward (wiping, hand washing). It also bothered me how many times it shows the kid getting off the potty. My daughter looks at the pics and gets up to imitate him which is not the part I want her to emulate!

Honestly though, I haven't really found many potty books I am altogether happy with. This is probably one of the better ones, but I still am not thrilled about it. It lacks educationally. Guess you can't win them all.

This is the first book about potty that our 16mos accepted. She loves books, but does not like the ones about potty. The pics are clear, the story is simple. We had to read this book to her many times in a row. Great book!

My 21 month old LOVES THIS BOOK. We got it a couple months ago and hes to the point he can read you it himself (he has memorized it) Also when he uses his potty he yells out "I did it ! Horray ! Undies" Just like they do in this story haha.  Overall this book is perfect for your little potty trainer or soon to be.

My son adores this book. He's 19 mo so we are just introducing the potty concept but he adores this book over books with flaps, sounds, etc. Loves the "Tinkle, Tinkle, toot" line. It seems unisex and says nothing about anatomy but is honest and straightforward.

After I bought a bunch of the other potty books including: Where's the Poop, A Potty Book for Girls and Karen Katz's lift the flap book "A Potty for Me". This book is simpler than those, so my daughter was easily able to connect the dots to understand that a potty is where you sit without your diaper. Has a lot of illustrative and adorable pictures, and is funny without being gross. Very easy to understand for 17 - 20 month-olds.

Highly recommended as a first potty book. Especially like how the baby observes that dogs and cats don't use diapers... and how the baby goes to get a book to make sitting on the potty more fun.  I especially love that this book isn't filled with tons of gendered colors, it's just a baby learning how to use a potty.

The other book I recommend is A Potty for Me, which is simply delightful but for a slightly older baby!
summary: Best as a first potty book

reviewText: My son was already familiar with some of Leslie Patricelli's books, like No No, Yes Yes and Baby Happy, Baby Sad, so he was excited to read this one. He's 18 months and approaching potty-trainable age, so we look at this book every day (sometimes more than once) and he's learning what a potty is and what it's for, and get's excited at the end when the baby in the book successfully completes potty training. He even goes and gets the potty from the bathroom and brings it out and sits on it sometimes. I really think this book has been good at introducing the potty to my son. Let's hope the rest of training goes so smoothly!
plus some pages don't even have words. it's hard to read it aloud to my child when the pages don't have words!
summary: good but lacks detail about how to go to the potty

reviewText:
This is a very cute approach to potty training, I bought my 14month old 2 books and this one is his favourite!
He loves the pictures that are full of expression!
He opens it to one particular page when he is sitting on the potty.
He still has a way to go, but the book keeps him entertained no doubt
Only thing is that we have to substitute the Americanised "diaper" with nappy when we are reading it to him.
Otherwise its a great little book and I would highly recommend.

I was looking for a potty training book that didn't use incorrect terms when referring to genitalia, and decided on this one with its androgynous child and no 'peepees,' 'hoohas,' or any other weird words.  The story is adorable!  The book is just the right size, with bold, cute illustrations.  It instantly became one of my son's favorites.  Sadly, it doesn't seem to have increased his interest in the potty.

This was a gift for my grandson. My daughter says he loves it. It is
a board book so it should last a long time.

Great for little ones about to potty train or in the midst of potty training. Our son goes on the potty to pee, but not poo.  This book got him interested in trying again and I think really helped pushed him to continue to try!  He loves the book, especially the part where the baby is dancing in his diaper and has to go.  No matter how many times we read it, he laughs.  A terrific purchase.
As an architect I liked being able to give my grandson a bedtime book featuring construction equipment. He's also crazy about all kinds of vehicles. The pictures and text are delightful.

My 2 year old son just received this book for his birthday. He loves reading it every night. The flow of the rhyming is light and fun, painting sweet images of these tired machines. The drawings are precious too with a couple of machines curling up with their special things.
summary: Very sweet book for a big machinery lover

reviewText: My 3-year old son loves this book and wants to read it every night.  The graphics are excellent and the rhymes are good too.  The author uses just the right number of new words for a 2-3 year old.  Italics are used on some parts of the text to allow the reader to shorten or expand the story.
summary: Perfect bedtime book for boys that like trucks and tractors

reviewText:
This is just a wonderful bedtime story for any young fan of big machinery.  The rhyming is spot on, creating a fantastic read aloud flow.  We get to say goodnight to each machine as it dozes off, creating just the right atmosphere for bedtime.  The illustrations have that classic old fashioned feel, done in muted colors with somewhat fuzzed edges. Each character has an expressive face that only adds to the charm of a story that is sure to be a much requested bed time read.  A note to any librarian or story group leader interested in doing a bedtime theme story time: this is a sure winner!  Just the perfect length for preschoolers.  A sleepy recommend.

2/14/17 - So excited to see this board book edition!  For all those really young kids who enjoy the picture book version, this represents an excellent opportunity for them to hold this story in their very own hands and tell it themselves!  The sturdy board pages make this book one that will last!
My 21-month old toddler got this book about a week ago, and he wants me to read it to him 20+ times/day! Loves having his Green Toys excavator and dump truck with him when I read the book.
Nice book, fun book for boys

I cannot understand why anyone (especially a female author) would write a book like this and make ALL of the characters male. Did it never occur to the author that children of both genders might love construction equipment? This is just another example of sexist children's literature. There are plenty of other books that do not discriminate (although I wish there were more about construction equipment). Extremely disappointing.
summary: Sexist Children's Book (set in a world where all construction vehicles are boys . . . )

reviewText: My grandson won't go to bed without first reading this book. It's adorable.
Great book, my grandson loved it.
Best first book pick from my six y.o. grandson
Great hit with the kiddos
My almost three year old loves this book!
Grandson loves construction vehicles, Perfect for him
summary: Perfect gift for kids who like construction toys

reviewText: This is a great bedtime book...darling illustrations. I also bought the matching pajamas for my grandson.
My toddler is a big fan of these big trucks going to sleep!
Both my son and daughter love this book. Its very cute and well done.

This was a gift. The gift was for a three year old boy and He seemed to really like it. I thought the pictures and the cute story were wonderful and well done. I would defiantly buy another copy for my own children's collection (at some later date since my kids just received a bunch of books from their Grandpa).
summary: The gift was for a three year old boy and He seemed to really like it. I thought the pictures and the cute ...

reviewText: This book is fantastic. My son loves rhyming books, and this one is so fun and catchy. The words really flow, unlike some rhyming books. I wouldn't r ecomend it until baby is a little older unless they're really good at sitting for long books though, because it is on the longer side.
summary: Fabulous night time book, a favorite!

reviewText: My great nephew likes it a lot!
Grandson loves books
Fun machines
Sweet!

This is such a cute and fun book. My 2YO son loves all things construction right now and he enjoys reading moons before bed so this one is perfect! The board book version is very steardy for toddler hands!
Excellent book.
This is the second one of these I've bought for Grandsons and love the story and graphics.  If your child likes construction equipment, this is a sweet bedtime book.
Our little one loves it!  He loves all things construction, but he isn't terribly articulate yet.
summary: but he isn't terribly articulate yet

reviewText: He loves it.
My 3 year old loves this book, and so do I l! The writing is really good, and it puts him to sleep. Win!
summary: The writing is really good, and it puts him to sleep

reviewText: This was my grandson's favorite book for about a year when he was two.

This is a really cute companion book to Steam Train, Dream Train. If you and your child enjoyed the train book, you'll like this one. The writing is very similar, and so is the art work. Only major difference is the theme. Both of these books are wonderful to read prior to bedtime, and will delight any little one (mine has been exposed to these books since he was 18mo.) who has an interest in trains or construction vehicles. Recommended!
Such a cute book, our son loves it - he is currently obsessed with all things that go!
This was a big mistake to purchase this book, it has such a few pages it is very expensive for what you get in terms of a story!
summary: This was a big mistake to purchase this book, ...

reviewText: This is my grandson's absolute favorite book, ever. I would happily recommend this book for any little one who loves construction toys. It's also a very good "go to sleep" book. His little eyes get heavy every time we read this. Our favorite page is where the crane is holding his teddy bear and a star night light is hanging over them. We have to ooh and aah over how sweet that teddy bear looks, every time we read it. I had it on Kindle for a long time and thought he would enjoy a paper copy. We are all big readers and this is such a great book.
summary: This is my grandson's absolute favorite book, ever

reviewText: This is my 2 year olds favorite bedtime book so far. We love it.
My son's favorite book so far!
my grandboys love the book
My son loves this book to go along with all his trucks and tractors toys.
summary: The if kid is into trucks and teactors, they will love it.

reviewText: A book that gets read over and over again but I don't get tired of

What a wonderful book! We are always looking for books to read before bed and what better than a book about sleeping! A great read that flows easily off your tongue. My child loves it, yours probably will too!
summary: What a wonderful book! We are always looking for books to ...

reviewText: We adore this book!  The rhyming is well done .  We are all learning the names of the trucks! :)
summary: We adore this book! The rhyming is well done ...

reviewText: My daughter loves this book! Its not just for boys!
This book will be a great book for little boy so in love with Construction and all vehicles involved in those processes!
Grandson loves this book!
This quickly became one of my 3 year old sons favorite bedtime books.  A bit on the long side though ;-)
summary: Perfect for the construction loving toddler boys

reviewText: Grandson's favorite book.  Has it memorized.
Perfect gift for 3yo boy's Birthday, paired with jammies!
Well done and fun.  I'll be purchasing more for other little people.

Beautiful illustrations.  Yea! to a dirty jobs book!  Yea! to a skilled trade book!  **But the author needs to learn the difference between cement and concrete.**  Without these skills, America's infrastructure will collapse.

My grandsons LOVE this book.  The authors should have book signings at libraries hosting a "big trucks" day.  Our local library had a special afternoon this summer and invited construction and emergency teams to bring their rigs to the parking lot.  The kids had a ball!  The only thing missing was a table with the construction site books and their author / illustrator!
My grandson loves this book
Little boys love
I started reading this book to our 2 year old grandson.  It was late afternoon so he was not tired yet, but I started feeling sleepy after the first page! Well written cadence for toddlers.
Super cute and a favorite for bedtime.
one of my son's favorites at bedtime!!!!
It's ok.
Great book for the young truck lover in your house.

My grandson is 27 months old and has been fascinated with heavy equipment for the last 6 months or so. This story was the perfect story for him. He said goodnight to all the characters and fell asleep 5 minutes after we turned the Kindle off.
I bought this for my grandson and he just loves this book!
My toddler loves this story- this boardbook is great for young ( little cubby) fingers and due to size,  it travels well too.
This will be his favorite!  purchased for my 3 year old nephew who loves construction equipment.  The book is so cute.

Loved it! Wonderful illustrations (even the background ) and lyrical text. I am sending it for a two-year old's birthday. I am sure he will love it because he is fascinated by  big construction vehicles.
summary: Art and Poetry for the Macho

reviewText: Both boys and girls will love this book about construction vehicles .
My son LOVES this book- its such a sweet nighttime story, and also one that I enjoy reading too.
Great story - clever rhymes as each piece of equipment prepares for sleep.  My 3 yo grandson loves it !!
Purchased for 2 year old grandson who is really into trucks and such. He loves it.
Cute book
My son loves this book.  We can now recite it from memory.  It is a must have for ANY little boy.  We often give it as a gift.
My little one is too young to get trucks and machines yet, but I am sure this will be a favorite in just a little bit. For the parent, its a nice bedtime book to read.
summary: but I am sure this will be a favorite in just a little bit

reviewText: One of our favorite bedtime stories for years!

The illustrations in this one are magnificent! They are super creative and bring life to the trucks and other construction equipment. They give the trucks faces and they use the environment as props. Just a dirt pile is a pillow for one truck, or steel beams on a construction project make ZzZzZzzZzz's to show another truck snoring. It's really creative!

The story isn't as good as Steam Train Dream Train, but it's nice. It's simple. Each page is another truck doing one last thing before going to sleep for the night.

It's a good calming book and I probably read it to my toddler once a week.

What a precious story to listen to at bed time for all those little ones who love trucks. My grandson just turned 3 and he thinks trucks rule! Now he can listen to how the trucks have to go to sleep every night, just like he does! I think we have a winner here! While he listens he can hold on to his new plush truck as he drifts off to sleep! The illustrations are wonderful, this books looks to be one of those long time family favorites.

This was a great purchase and I highly recommend. The plush truck that came in this set is the perfect size for a toddler or preschooler. It's just right for carrying around all day and snuggling all night. Next I plan on purchasing the Mighty, Mighty Construction Site, by the same author.

ISBN 9781452111735 is something many moms and dads have been waiting for: a boardbook version of GOODNIGHT, GOODNIGHT, CONSTRUCTION SITE.

GOODNIGHT (GGCS) is a great readaloud, as I'm sure you already know. The book is perfect for those kids that like construction equipment and things-that-go. In this book the guys are finishing up after a hard days work. The Crane and the Cement Mixer, for example, are shown wrapping up the day and settling down.

Besides being a good Goodnight Read, I like that this book uses good rhyming and that it gives me and other parents a chance to name the various machines and describe what they do. Besides the two named above the book includes Excavator, Bulldozer, and Dump truck.

Highly recommend. GOODNIGHT, GOODNIGHT, CONSTRUCTION SITE has a lot going for it.
--Good word play/rhymes that make for a good readaloud.
--Soften artwork which is as restful as the text.
--It's educational: you can name equipment and describe what they do.

The board book itself has thick, sturdy pages.
summary: Great Read & Readaloud, this boardbook has thick, sturdy pages

My son religiously wants me to read either Goodnight, Goodnight Construction Site or Sleep Train Dream Train to him every night.

Similar in style - they both use a rhythmic tone for the words along with the dark, grainy, sleepy backdrop for illustrations - automatically creating a night time mood. The story is about a construction site and all the construction vehicles like excavator, bulldozer, cement truck (and more), they are all doing their last chore before they get ready to go to bed. When the vehicles are tucked in tight the next words are "Shhhhhh goodnight". Miracle. Both my son and I start nodding off after our busy construction site kind-a-day. This is a very well written book and the illustrations are spot on. My son is 23 months old.

reviewText: My son loves construction trucks. This book is one of his favorites, the illustrations are beautiful too.

A great introduction to the goings on at a construction site.  The many different types of big machinery and all their intricate parts are illustrated beautifully, and each trucks very unique job on the site is described in pure poetic form.  The days are very busy at a construction site, and the trucks are tired at the end of a long, hard day of work.

Why I Like This Book: I just love the rhythm. Who doesnt enjoy a rhyming picture bookBig machines and dreams? Sounds like a winner to me.  The whimsical illustrations bring the big machines and the construction site to life. Anyone who is fascinated by building and the wheels that complete the big jobs will be bulldozed over by all the heavy metal in this book. A very sweet story indeed surely to send the little ones wheeling off to dreamland ! Goodnight, Goodnight, Construction Site

With all the emphasis on STEM programs, this book would be a great reintroduction to basic machines and how they work.

reviewText:
This is a very nice story, and I enjoyed reading it with my son.  Only four stars for this review though for a couple of reasons:

First, when I sat down to read this book with my son, I found that it had two pairs of pages still bound together at the top right corner.  I did not want to get up and get a knife to properly cut the pages apart, so I tried to separate them with my hands and ended up tearing one of the pages a little.  Oh well, my fault for being a little lazy, but still a slight quality issue.

Second, and this is mostly the reason for my one-star deduction, I feel that the story could have been better organized so that you would not have to go back and forth between day and night as each truck is discussed.  It seems to me that the story could have remained in the day for each truck, then in the late afternoon for each truck, and then in the evening for each truck.

This is just my opinion and maybe some will disagree, but I think the story would flow better with a stabler timeline.
summary: Very Nice Story But Too Much Back and Forth Among Time Settings.

reviewText:
You know, sometimes I could just kick myself for not finding out about some things sooner, especially such a terrific little book as this!  When this book was published in 2011, I babysat full time for our oldest grandson while my daughter-in-law was in the work force, he was 3 years old and was HEAVY into Thomas the train.  We'd begun a collection of diecast trains for him, along with the Island of Sodor's construction team (called "The Pack"), and each and EVERY day at naptime he would have to say "goodnight" to each and every one of them individually - this darling book does exactly that, saying an individual goodnight to the rough and tough crane, cement mixer, dump truck, bulldozer and excavator, who are all calming down and getting ready to call it a night (with all of the typical bedtime rituals included in the book - taking a bath, getting tucked in, curling/snuggling up, dimming the lights and shutting the door) - it would have been absolutely PERFECT!

We've added a couple of more grandsons since then, and though Mommy is now a full-time mom and I no longer get to partake in all of the traditional naptime rituals with our 4 or 2 year old grandsons (big brother's a 3rd grader already!), I went ahead and bought this for the youngest's 2nd birthday.  Whether it's naptime or bedtime, the calming way this book is written coupled with the cute illustrations of the vehicles yawning, shutting their eyes, etc., is bound to be a sure-fire winner for any parent or grandparent tasked with helping a youngster to "Turn off your engines, stop your tracks, relax your wheels, your stacks, and backs.  No more huffing and puffing, Team:  It's time to rest your heads and dream.  Construction site, all tucked in tight, the day is done, turn off the light.  Great work today!  Now... shh... goodnight."  Even "tough" kids need their rest too!

Especially if read in a quiet, soothing tone, I can't think of a more perfect bedtime book.  You know how seeing someone yawn usually makes you yawn yourself?  I think that's the exact effect the illustrations will have... I'm just envious of my son and daughter-in-law for getting to be the ones to read it to him!  (And if I raised my son right, he'll be reading this to my first grandDAUGHTER who's arriving in October in just a couple of years as well!)
summary: Oh why, oh WHY didn't I find out about this book sooner?!

reviewText: My sons favorite book! He loves the story, the pictures, the animation (with words). I don't mind reading it constantly either because it's so cute! Every little boy needs this story!

My 3 year old received this as a Christmas gift from his grandparents and HE LOVES IT. (And since I work in construction, I sort of love it too, lol!) The first week I read it two time in a row each night. By the second week he was "reading" the last word of every sentence, then by week three he was "reading" with me word for word. Beautifully illustrated, wording is on point and well spaced for a relaxed tone, perfect for a bedtime story.

My son loves this book! So much so I know it by heart...minus the page he ripped out months ago!  It really has a beautiful cadence and rhythm to it that cannot be beat, going from the highs and speed and pace of a busy day and then dipping down to the cozy, tired lows.  And it repeats this perfect ebb and flow with, I believe, 5 different machines. Intersperse your own sighs and yawns and breaths to it, the highs and lows of your own voice's pitch and inflection...and this book never fails to put both listener and reader into a ready-for-sleep state.  Honestly, it's like listening to tide coming in and going out!
There are few children's books I like better!
summary: It really has a beautiful cadence and rhythm to it that cannot be beat

reviewText:
My 2.5yr old loves books...we read throughout the day and he needed new material so I asked moms in a mom fb group for suggestions. This got the most mentions so I bought it. This has since become the very first book that my son requests every night as part of night bed time routine. He loves it so much, not only do I read it twice as he's in bed but I also bought mini trucks for him to hold as we go through each of the trucks in the book. It's more than just a book, it's a way for my son and I to have special mommy/baby time every night as I read to him while he actively follows along, learning about each truck. ((Bulldozer is his favorite...particularly loves the "CRUUUUUUUUNCH" lol))
Beautiful book that's creating memories I'll cherish for a lifetime!!
summary: Bonding, learning, reading and fun all in one book

It's one of his favorite books in our collection and he would read it over and over if you would let him! Highly recommend. Fun for little boys that love diggers and dump trucks, and a nice way to show that everything has a way it's day- and it's time for bed :)

reviewText:
Goodnight, Goodnight Construction Site ...Sherri Duskey Rinker is a wonderful book for children.  We purchased it along with Where Do Diggers Sleep at Night?  by Brianna Caplan Sayres for a grand-daughter, who is enamored with large construction equipment.  The book is well written with truly fine illustrations.  Our grand-daughter loves both books very much.

Nate Lerner

reviewText: For my two year-old son who is obsessed with excavators (or "backhoes" as he calls them), this is the perfect bedtime book. It goes through several construction site vehicles and shows how they wind down at the end of the day. The anthropomorphic equipment "plays hard" all day, and will again tomorrow, but for tonight, they snuggle into their cozy parking spots, don teddy bears and blankets and go to bed. the artwork is very nice, the size is nice and large and the length is just about perfect to hold my boy's interest.
summary: Perfect for your son or daughter who loves construction machines.

My construction truck obsessed two-year-old LOVES this book. We read it every night before bed. I keeo it upstaira in his bedroom now. When it was downstairs with his other books, we would read it over and over and over again. He has a lot of it memorized.

I received this book from the publisher for my review. I am very happy with this book. I love board books for little children. I think they are the best. Goodnight, Goodnight, Construction Site is a perfect bedtime story and is especially great for little folks who are interested in machinery of this type. My older grandson who is really too big for this type of book enjoyed reading it and liked the information. I was pleased about that. We like the illustrations that are colorful without being overly bright - just perfect for getting ready for a nap or bedtime! We particularly enjoyed the faces on the equipment. This is a really pleasant, appealing book for young readers as well as non-readers who need a good storybook. The wording is clever and holds your attention. Very good book.

My 4 year old son loves the story, the big trucks and equipment, the rhyming and the illustrations!  You really can't go wrong for any child that likes building equipment and a cute, rhyming story.

For people complaining about how the story is all "HE" and male-trucks.  When I read stories to my little guy, I always change things up if I don't like it.  I add words, delete words, change sentences - to my liking.  Since my son is only 4 and can't read yet, I easily change 2 of the trucks to "SHE".  Crane Truck is a "SHE" when I read it, and so is "CEMENT MIXER".

When he's old enough to read stories for himself, I'm sure he will have grown out of this book.

I still think it's a cute, clever book.

reviewText:
Good Night Construction Site is about trucks that are sleepy and cool. The book shows you what the trucks do last each day before they go to sleep. One truck shown is the mixer and the book shows him washing himself at the end of the day. If you want to see what the other trucks do you should read this book.

  My favorite part is when it said Good night construction site. I can relate to the trucks because after I had a long day I felt tired and sleepy.

  I would recommend this book for 5 years old and under. If you are in kindergarten you should like it because my sister liked it when she was in kindergarten. I liked looking at the pictures. Now good night, reader. Go get this book!

We originally found this at the library but had to get our own (thanks, Grandma!) as my 2.5 son wanted this read every day. And, unlike with some children's books, I don't mind at all... the words are rhythmic and soothing, the artwork beautiful.

Love this story, and so does my son.  I got this at my baby shower, and my son is almost 2, and I haven't tired of it yet.  He's really gotten into it lately, too.  I bought a copy for one of my nephews as well.

My toddler boys are into everything that moves. I introduced this book when they were almost 2, but I think I should have introduced them at 18 months. By then they had a vehicles book and knew everything in there, so they could have related to this book. But better late than never. They really like this book - they like all the construction vehicles and I make them act what each vehicle is doing like yawning, how they are sleeping, etc. It is a short and quick book, but covers the top construction vehicles. Perfect bedtime reading. I just with it had more vehicles, 5-6 is nothing and it is done in a minute. They should have had at least 10-12 vehicles.

We checked this book out of the library so much, it was time to get a copy for our home library. With a little guy that absolutely loves construction vehicles of all varieties, this book is right up his alley. Each truck has a job to do during the day, and at night it is time to tuck each one in and tell them good night, just as we tuck the little guy in. It is a book I don't mind reading frequently, which says a lot.

reviewText: Love, love, love! The way the story is written is fabulous. The rhyming words, the words used for each machine, the photos that go with each machine are genius. My son, 2years and 3 months old, loves to have it read to him every single night. He's learned the name of each machine and has even begun to memorize the story. (I overheard him reciting some of the words that correlate to each page) I have purchased a few to give out as gifts. That's how much I love it.

Given my child's interest in construction vehicles, this book was recommended by several friends before I made the purchase.  The drawings and text are wonderful, he loves it and we do too.

The one thing that could be better is the placement of the text.  We're trying to teach our son to read by following the text with our finger, but doing so inevitably covers the drawings and my son asks us to stop.  This has never happened with any other book.  But this is a minor complaint -- it is a wonderful book.

This is one of my boys' favorite bedtime books! It is so cute! They love reading about the construction mighty machines do their last routines for the day before bed time. The drawing is very nice as well. Highly recommended.

reviewText: I bought GGCS for my 2 1/2-year-old grandson, who loves construction equipment AND had developed sleep problems after some extended travel and then a series of colds. When I showed him the book (in the afternoon), he said "I want to go to bed now!" After reading the book that night, and every night of my visit, he fell asleep easily, and slept through the night, for the first time in weeks. So I have to conclude that the book is magic.

This has quickly become my 2 year old son's favorite book. He will drop everything to come over for some reading time if I pull it out! The pictures are incredible and the prose is concise, simple, yet not 'dumbed down' -- and in an easy rhyme that holds my toddler's attention. A must-have for anyone whose child is really into construction vehicles!

The ONLY downside, as another reviewer has noted, is that all of the characters in this book are male. I find this problematic as I don't want my son growing up thinking that there are 'boy things' and 'girl things.' I don't see why construction vehicles and this book can't be appealing to both genders! To address this, when I read aloud to him I substitute 'she/her' instead of 'he/his' for alternate characters. Which is great, until he gets old enough to read for himself. To be fair, this highly gendered subject material is not just an issue for this book specifically, but for most children's books that deal with traditionally 'boys only' subjects in general.
summary: great for kids into construction vehicles!

We live out in the country and he gets to see all of the farm machinery out and about in the fields. He just loves it! A Fascinating, rhyming introduction to large construction machinery that will hold the interest of the very young. Beautiful, humorous illustrations. Yes, change those gender pronouns if you must. Additionally, some elaboration would be helpful when you come upon numerous terms in the reading of the story--even words to explain these terms may need explaining or illustrating: All fun: Examples follow: 1. Blade: Not of a knife, but a heavy metal "plate" in front of the "tractor" 2. Grade: A level or slope of land 3. Thunderous: Sound only 4. Bed: Floor platform or hauling section of a truck; also a soft level of dirt--and more 5. Chute: An extension for delivering loose material on a slide to a lower level 6. Churning: Mixing 7. Boom: Not a sound, but a support "beam" of a crane 8. Crane: Extend--whether it's ones neck for a metal beam and the machine that "cranes" 9. Site: As opposed to sight, what one sees 10. Stack: Not a pile, but a "vertical" "exhaust"/emptying pipe 11. Excavator: A machine that scoops (yes, using a scoop) to make a hole, "trench" or "channel" Picture Book: Fictionalized Non-Fiction (Grades Pre-K-1 or 2) The Creative Teacher: Activities for Language Arts (Grades 4 through 8 and Up)

summary: Essential Bedtime Book for the Toddler who LOVES Trucks

reviewText: LOVE this book!  It is a great little story about all the big equipment winding down and going to sleep.  A great goodnight story for any child who loves trucks and construction.
Our grandson loved it.  We had the downloaded Kindle version, making the print very small;  but really a nice, rhyming story.  Would recommend ordering the hard copy version of this book.
My two year old son loves this book. We've been reading it almost every night. And it was cheap too, considering it's a large hardback book. At the book store those type of books go for a fortune.
Adorable book! Lovely illustrations. Fun to read! A must for little boys!

Very well done book! Beautiful pictures! Nice story.
My 2 year old son's FAVORITE book!
Would buy again as a gift!
summary: Great bed time book for boys!

reviewText: Adorable story with rhyming words about construction vehicles winding down, finishing their day and going to bed.
summary: Adorable story for your sleepy little one

reviewText: If you have children who are obsessed with trucks and construction equipment, this is the perfect book for them! My 3 year old asks for it every night, along with Where Do Diggers Sleep at Night?
summary: this is the perfect book for them

reviewText: Grandson wants to read it over and over he loves it and that whas what counts
Very nice illustrations and story. My toddler enjoys it and helps to calm him down before bedtime.
This is a really cute book, my 2 year old son kisses every truck goodnight as we read along.
My son is 2.5 and loves this book. I'm glad I took the advice of other reviewers and got this book for him. It's a wonderful read before bed-time and perfect for any construction loving child!

We received this book as a gift and my 15 month old son (who loves all things related to trucks, diggers and construction) has been asking to read it every night before bed. Great story line, great illustrations. Two thumbs up from this mama!
summary: Great bedtime book for young truck enthusiasts!

reviewText: Excellent book.  Our two year old seems to really enjoy this one.  It seemed a little long at first, but the words flow nicely.  I do find some of the descriptive sounds a bit out of place. For example, "...Excavator shapes the land.  He digs and lifts throughout the day (arrgh!)...," Is Excavator really a pirate?  :)  I just leave the ones I don't care for out.  No reason not to buy the book or to remove stars.  The pictures are sweet and colorful.  I'd recommend this book to others.
My son loves this book!
One of our favorite books!  Great read before bedtime.
My 2 and 5 year old both enjoy this book, and I think it is one they will enjoy for a long time.  The illustrations are beautiful.
summary: My 2 and 5 year old both enjoy this book

reviewText: Perfect, thanks
Great book for little boys!

My two year old memorized the rhymes in this book. Pages and pages of rhymes about sleepy construction vehicles that he can now recite. If your child is gaga over trucks, this will be a good nighttime read.
summary: this will be a good nighttime read

reviewText: My grandkids ESPECIALLY loved it.
Fun to read over and over. Great for bedtime.
My son loves this story and saying good night to each one of the construction vehicles.  Great way to wind a toddler down who loves trucks.
summary: Great bedtime story for truck loving boys

reviewText: best book ever!
Grandson and Great-grandchildren are enjoying this cute and very nicely illustrated story.

little great grandbaby loves this book...a SHE btw...it puts her to sleep at night & has really enhanced her interest in trucks of all kinds now so she is learning the names of all kinds of large working vehicles...
summary: reccomend for both sexes...VERY Well written with beautiful pics

reviewText: My nephew loves this book. It's good for a range of ages and the illustrations are adorable.
summary: It's good for a range of ages and the illustrations are ...

reviewText:
Unbelievably cute story and lovely illustrations.

I love how the text rhymes, and it is still quite thoughtful and sound.
Really cute story for boys and girls.
Great bedtime story for truck loving kids.
One of our grandson's favorite books.  He loves construction vehicles -- the drawings are fun to look at the the text is easy to read (and apparently to memorize as well !)

Probably the cutest story I've seen lately, very original, very colorful and a sweet story about construction equipment, how they work during the day, get tired, and eventually go to sleep at night.  The story equates very well to small children, and they love to look at the pictures.
MY LITTLE GRANDSON LOVED IT. His great grandfather owned a road construction company so this book was relevant to our family business.

Simple and repetitive, yet very creative. One of my son's favourites (age 4) but also enjoyed by my older daughter (age 7) who can also easily read it. The story is a simple one of all the different construction vehicles finishing up the day and tucking themselves in for bed.
It's clever and well illustrated. I read it at least twice every night to my son.  Must read for kids!

This book was listed on the 2013 list of Illinois Reads books, indicating that the author has some connection to the state.  I find the illustrations delightful and the story enjoyable - one that might be asked for over and over.  This book will go to my first great grandchild come August.
just as expected
Great book to read before bedtime'
We are loving ALL of the new tractor books we got.....!  Its hard to read the same ones over and over and over and over!
This is the first and only book he requests. Great for small children.  He is almost four and we have been reading this for over a year.
Great for "Good Night Moon" graduates, ready to move from seeing the mouse to building the house. For Big Machine fans. Gender slanted, sadly.

This is a great book. From our apt window, we see a construction site and my daughter (3yo) loves to reas this book and talk about the trucks she saw that day. It rhymes nicely and is long enough to be a substantial book for preschool without beihg overly long when they are tired.
My grandson loves this book very much. I must say that I'm sick of reading it to him. He calls it "Bulldozer" and he constantly says "Read Bulldozer".

This is the second time I purchased this book here in Amazon.  The first time was when my son was only 2 yrs old. I read it to him everynight and whenever he asked me to. It was one of his favorite book.  He is now 4 yrs old and we have relocated to Saipan recently (from California) and I did not bring this book with us, assuming my son have outgrown this book. But alas, he actually asked me where his "goodnight construction" book last week.  When I told him, I left it in California, the boy was disappointed. I thought he'd forget about it as I bought him lots of different books here in the island.  After his 3rd ask, I decided to order this book for him again. I'm sure he will be surprise and happy once we received it.

If u have a child who loves trucks, this book is a must have.  I also suggest buying the toy state CAT construction trucks with this book.  My son loves to read and play with these combo for hours at end.
My 2 year old knows every word by heart - great book to go along with Steam Train Dream Train
A charming book, perfect for my 2-year-old grandson! Very sweet story with a charming, lilting narrative! A wonderful introduction to poetry for little ones! Very well-written!

Great rhymes and I love how after explaining what each big truck does all day it shows them doing some kind of bed time ritual.  This book is a favorite.  For some reason, the other train by these authors ("Dream Train, Steam Train") did not have the same effect on my son and he never wants to read that one.

I had never seen this book before, but was excited to find it to use in my preschool classroom.  The boys really get into the machinery books and this book is so well written, it should encourage a lot of good language and discussion. The rhyming is natural and the pictures are wonderful.  It is well done, and I can hardly wait to read it out loud to my preschool class.
It came well packaged and in a timely manner.  I know it will be one of my new favorites to use next year, and years to come. Thanks for offering it at such a fair price,  especially, hard bound. The  Goodnight Construction Site book  will be a favorite for years to come!
My grandsons love this story because they absolutely adore any kind of truck and, of course, especially love the construction trucks.  Kind of like the superheroes of turcks.

I got this for my 3 year old nephew.  The family is in the process of building
a new home and he is fascinated with the construction site.  He thinks this
book was written especially for him.
My child loves the portrayal of the various types of construction trucks. He enjoys listening to the rhymes as well.
Cute and fun story! Great colors and bright pictures. Fun for all young children to read at bedtime or anytime!

My husband works construction and our son just turned 1 so we ordered this as a birthday present for him. It's so cute, hard back so should hold up for a long time. It's on his dresser and I bet will be a favorite of his once hes a little older!
My son and daughter want me to read this to them every night. It is a perfect bedtime story book
My 18mo son loves this book, just as much as he loves cars and construction materials. It is very descriptive as to what each machine does

Bought this for my 3 year old son.  My daughter loves it too.  Great rhyming and easy to read out loud.  Fun pictures and my kids are able to reference the bulldozers and other equipment when we drive by a real construction sight.  Fun.
summary: Good rhyming and easy to read outloud

reviewText: 5 yr old Patrick loves this book which has replaced his normal bedtime story!  His mother said I chose the perfect book.
summary: Perfect for a kid who loves Goodnight Moon!

reviewText: My 3 year old loves construction sites.  This book is the perfect amount of reading for his attention span, and he also looks forward to going to bed for us to read the book.  He asks everyone he sees what's your favorite construction vehicle? Great book for this age group.
My two youngest grandsons LOVE this book.  I even purchased small machinery for them to hold as the book is read to them.  I highly recommend it.

This book is a gift for my best friend's son who celebrated his one year old. The boy loved it and always want the book to be read to him every night before sleep. To top that, the boy liked the cement mixer so much.
summary: Good book for a start for one year old

reviewText: This book was ordered for my son who loves construction and machines. It's a cute bedtime story that helps my little one unwind. The illustrations are also very well done. I recommend this book.

We purchased this for our grandson who will be turning two in June.  We purchased this book along with Dexter building toys and also based on another review. Our grandson is really in to books along with trucks and etc.

This book was a great purchase if for nothing else my son doesn't fight going to bed as he brings this book into bed with him and although he is not reading properly yet (he is 3) he looks at the pictures and makes up his own stories about the vehicles. I think your child has to really be into construction and the vehicles like dump trucks and excavators to appreciate this book.
summary: My son lives construction and this book

reviewText: My 2 year old grandson wants this book read to him over and over.  He loves it.  The illustrations are wonderful.
This is my 2 year olds favorite book. We read it at least a few times a day. He earned it with positive behavior and loves to tell me that he "bought" it =)
My grandson loved his story and the pictures of the large equipment.  He plays with his toy "equipment" frequently.  When out and about he can point out the machines to his Mom too!

This is a cute rhyming book with pictures of equipment settling in for the night after a long day of work. Our family likes it, but not as much as the author's other, similar book, "Steam Train, Dream Train." It isn't a book that I dread reading nightly if it were to be requested a few times in a row.
summary: Very cute read for construction equipment fans

reviewText: My toddler loves this book so much! We purchased it during Christmas with a pack of 3 CAT trucks that are so much fun. He was about 17 months at the time. It's written well (nicely flowing rhymes and small enough words for little ones to understand and still learn more) and has great illustrations. This is the first "long" book he would sit through in its entirety. It definitely keeps his interest and usually at the end, he'll ask for more and we end up reading it about 3 times. He also loves finding the moon on each page. Definitely a fun book for little boys. :)

My son just loves this book to pieces! We have this one and Steam Train, Dream Train as well. The beauty of this book is amazing, and my son loved the rhyming feel of the book. It is a constantly read book and it surprised me how much my son and also, I, loved it! I just bought it because he loves construction machines! Best 2 purchases made in books this year! Get the second one, too! I hope there will be a third!

This is such a well-written story for kids of very short attention spans but still wanting all the elements that come with being read a bedtime story.  He is very into construction vehicles as it is, so this storyline is perfect for the little [3-year old] boy I gifted it to.  His mom says he wants it read to him every night!
summary: Wants this read to him each night

reviewText: I bought two of these, one for each grandson.  Illustrations are great.  Can't wait to give it to them soon.
Ok my goodness this book is super cute! Its perfect for a little boys bedtime stories. I love that they went over the different types of construction equipment.
Great story, great rhythm, just an overall great book.  Kids who love trucks will doubly enjoy this book.  BUY IT
The book is a little expensive but if you have a two year old child who is into machinery this book fits the bill.

If they like machinery or a good night book this is a good one.
Kids ask for it alot and love the pictures.
One of the best books for preschoolers to come out in a long time. The names of the machines and their purposes are accurate to real large machine operators. Still reads well for a 3 year old
My 4 year old son loves this book.  We read it to him often and he doesn't get tired of it.
What a cute book! My baby boy loves it! Not many boys books out there, but this is a must have for a little boy.
summary: Great book for a little boy...

reviewText: ...it rhymes, explains the different machines, and is so approachable for boys or girls. My toddler girls love it and we know all the names of the equipment whenever we pass a construction site.
summary: This is such a cute book...

reviewText: My two year old grandson is in love with trucks, tractors and every piece of equipment  at a construction site. We love this book.
My little boy loves this book. At 17 months old, it's one of the only books he will let me read all the way through.
My three year old grandson wanted it read to him every night for months!  Really a good book.  Really.  Really!!!
My 3 year old spent hours pouring over the pages of this book,  he loves it. Would buy for another boy.
My 3 year old daughter and I love reading this story. The pictures are fun and captivating. I will continue to recommend this book  to others.
Clever rhymes and adorable illustrations make this a bedtime favorite for our preschooler. Us parents don't get tired of reading it, either, because the rhyme meter feels soothing.
My 2 year old grandson loves this book.  And since his father and grandfather are in the construction field, everybody loves it.
This is a nice book but I ended up not needing it for a Christmas present so I returned it.
Wonderful book, great illustrations.  Just right for bedtime.  Nice big well-made book with dust cover.  A favorite that will last (previous paperback was worn out from use.

Bought this for my young nephew. He loves it, which means I love it. When it comes to reviewing children's books, I tend to trust the opinion of the audience for who it's meant. In this case, a great little book for boys who like trucks and tractors.
My son loves this book. It's a bit longer but it keeps his attention. We recently bough "Steam Train, Dream Train" and it's as amazing as this. Highly recommend both!
Birthday present for grandson.  His parents read to him every night. He loves the book and the colorful illustrations are great also.
summary: It was a hit. My grandson loved it.

reviewText: This book is delightful. It has a cadence that helps the book flow easily and lets little ears pick up the words quickly.  Great Buy!
summary: Sometimes I think I love this book more than my son

reviewText: My grandson loves this book so much I am giving as a gift to new babies. Illustrations are wonderful along with the story.
According to my 4 year old grandson the book is a winner and he likes to have read at bedtime.

i like it, toddler isn't impressed, but it'll probably grow on her as she gets a bit older.  we will see

update: she's definitely more interested in it now after a few weeks.

My son regularly requests I read this book to him. We have it on Kindle, but wanted to give a hard copy as a baby shower present. The only fault with the book, is that the shipper did not wrap it adequately. The book pages are warped due to the rainy day the package was delivered on.

reviewText:
I bought this book as a present for a friend's son's first birthday party and opted for this fun variant on the popular "good night moon" original. Little did I know how popular this book would have been for my friend's son - apparently he asks for it to be read to him nearly every night!  He must really enjoy construction vehicles ...

Anyhow it is a great means of encouraging reading in youngsters.  The artwork looks to be appropriate and fun as well.

My 3.5 year old son and I really enjoy this bedtime book.  It's bedtime at the construction site, and you're taken through the bedtime routines of the machinery until everything is asleep. Very cute story and great illustrations!

What is it about this book? There's something magical about this story that made my toddler fall asleep only at the second reading! Let's deconstruct: - the rhythm and rhyme are very good, very pleasant to the ear of both the child and the parent. - Then there are all the blue illustrations that have a tranquilizing effect on the active little readers, - then there are the "shhh, good night" bits, which have a profound sleeping effect on the child. While it does seem to be targeted towards boys (it's all about trucks!), my daughter fell asleep to this book as opposed to several other ones that we tried last night. And we tried quite a few! She usually chooses the books herself and while I'm delighted that she often chooses mine (her recent favorite is Maya & Filippo Play Chef at Sea (Volume 2)) she's just too excited about them to fall asleep. To conclude, it's a great bedtime read even for girls.
summary: Better than a sleeping pill...even for girls!

reviewText: Love it-- a bBoard book, rhyming story, and big construction equipment = recipe for success for a 3 year old boy!
My 3 year old grandson loves "diggers" and he love this book. We read it all the time. The pictures are great.

My two year old absolutely lives this book.  The illustrations are beautiful.  It is such a fun way to begin our bedtime routine by telling the crane truck, dump truck, bulldozer, excavater and cement mixer goodnight!
summary: Great bedtime book for truck lovers

reviewText: A must for every child!  So cute and the illustrations are fantastic. This is one that my 2 1/2 year old son brings out often for me to read to him.

It's a good book. A good story for kids. I have twins. A boy and a girl. They both love it. The illustrations are nice too.  The story is about how after a hard days of work, big construction machineries like the bulldozer, excavator and dump truck unwind and say good night. It is a nice story. Though I agree perhaps two should have been female. It would have been better. Still the story is nice and the pictures are beautifully done. Would recommend it.
Funny how my son sees things in the illustrations I don't notice and l love how he starts to yawn as all the trucks go to sleep

My little 3 year old guy loves this book and likes to make sounds for each of the construction equipment. He snuggles his little stuffed excavator as well while we read right before bed. The sleepy construction equipment help my little guy to settle down as well and get ready for bed.  Enjoy!
summary: Rhymes and construction themes makes this a great winner for boys and all kids

reviewText: A perfect bed time story for those active boys who love trucks and learning about all the different kinds of trucks.

My 2.5 year old son makes my husband read this to him every night. He know all the trucks by type & class them out on each page. The rhyme is a little forced so it's not so easy to read (the rhythm feels off). But overall, it's a big hit in our home

My 3 year old grandson is totally enamored with tractors and this book arrived after he and I spent an afternoon watching bobcats load and unload gravel, then a big dump truck emptied a full load of gravel.  I sent it home with him and he loves, loves, loves this book so I've just reordered one to read when he visits me.  The pictures are wonderful and the text is simple enough that I expect he'll have it memorized in no time and will "pretend" to read it to me.
good bed time story for any truck loving kid. Beautifully illustrated. Worth buying one. My son loved this story and the pictures.
This books is fantastic.  The story is great, the ryming is great, pictures are great, and quality is great!  My 4 yr old son loves it, and I really enjoy reading it to him.
I bought this book for my 17 month old grandson. He loves this book. The pictures are colorful, and cute. I will be buying another one for my other grandson, when he is a little older.

My 9 month old son loves all things construction or truck related.  Even when he was only a few months old, this book held his attention.  The story is just the right length - not to short (so that you feel the need to read 3 or 4 stories) and not too long (so that he gets bored before its over).  I highly recommend this book and have even bought it for a few friends (with kids both older and younger).

THIS IS A WONDERFUL BOOK TO READ LITTLE CHILDREN AT BEDTIME.  WHEN I READ IT TO MY GRANDCHILDREN, IT BECAME SLEEPY READING IT!  I HIGHLY RECOMMEND IT.  THE ILLUSTRATIONS & THE QUIET NARRATIVE  ARE VERY GOOD.

This is one of our favorite books. We love everything to do with truck/construction tractors so this was perfect for my 2-yr old boy. We like the  rhythm and the fact that they are going to sleep. Perfect bedtime story!
My grandson is in his dump truck, bulldozer, backhoe, etc. stage.  He loves this book and has learned to use the work excavator properly.  He's three!
Every time I am with my grandson the is 1 1/2 years old he wants me to read him his book
This is a must buy for a Daddy and son to have bedtime story reading together with all his favorite equipment.
All the familiar trucks and heavy equipment are represented  with colorful, clever rhyme.  As grandma, this is a happy book to read!

My 3 1/2 year old grandson is really into construction toys.  He comes over to Grandma's house to play with them and just before bed we read this story to help him wind down.  The book is very well written and seems to really sooth him.
This was a gift for my son from a dear friend who knows the author. Kudos it great. It's my go to boys gift because it speaks to the boys. My daughter loves it to!

i have a daycare and this book is the little boys favorite naptime choice!!! I have ordered a few as gifts for the boys that just cant get enough of this book at daycare.  The rhymes are catchy and the names are accurate for the vehicles so the kids really learn about the things they see at any building site.
summary: great book for little ones that love construction equip!!

reviewText: In response to the other review, yes all machines are male, but regardless, I absolutely love this book (and I am a mom to one daughter). She is too young to enjoy this book, however, my three nephews (ages 3, 3, and 4) all LOVE this book. The pictures are adorable and the rhyming is perfect. This is one book I do not mind reading over and over again, every night. After reading this book I made certain to purchase it for another friend with a construction-loving son and it was a definite hit. Can't go wrong with this one.
summary: Love this. Awesome Book. Must have.

reviewText: This book is a favorite of my 2 year old grandson.  He loves construction equiqment and trucks and this is a great bed-time story for him.  It has rhyme and rhythm as well as great illustrations.  I have purchased several of these for young boys.  It would be a perfect baby gift, too.

We installed this bedtime story on both my grandson's mini iPad and mine, i started to read to him on only one iPad until, along the days and nights, he started to follow the story on his own iPad, and since I went back home reads it to himself.
I never knew reading a bedtime story electronically would be as much fun as reading from a hard cover picture book and I must say I am totally converted now!
These trucks are so friendly, taking a personality of their own through amazing illustrations, the rythym of the story becomes hypnotic while told aloud, the moon and the stars very inviting in their promise of rest and sleep.
Parents, grandparents, do not miss the chance to bond through bedtime stories with this fun book!
summary: One of our all favorite books, my 3 years old grandson and I!

reviewText: My granddaughter enjoys reading this book and has a great interest in all this related to building.  This is great for toddlers.
summary: Perfect reading for early introduction to construction

reviewText: Very sweet book for a night time story for a little boy.  He loves it and the matching stuffed back hoe gave all the adults a good giggle.
I bought the book as a gift for my 13 month old grandson, he loves it.  He especially like the pictures.
This was fun to read as well as looking at the pictures!  I bought it as a gift and was pleased with my purchase!

Our grandson won't go to sleep unless one of us reads this story to him. He loves trains & trucks & vehicles, so this sweet goodnight story is the perfect bedtime book for him. Beautiful illustrations, too.
This is a great book with great illustrations. My 2 year old loves it and I would highly recommend it to others.

A great book for any vehicle, construction equipment loving child!  My toddler is loving this at two-years-old, especially at bedtime.  Charming rhymes, adorable illustrations of the construction equipment and great actions and descriptions of what they do!  My son is fascinated the whole way through.

Several trucks from a construction site are alive in this bright, colorful book that has enchanting rhyming phrases that make the kids giggle.  In a silly way it briefly describes what some of the trucks do on the job, such as the swirling cement truck and then is shows them shutting down for the night.  As do lots of little boys, my four year old grandson loves vehicles and finds this book very appealing and begs to have it read to him.
My young nephew thought this books was way cool.  It was an unexpected Christmas gift for him and he loved it.
summary: Great little book for boys into building anything!

reviewText: It was recommended on the Amazon site, so I took a chance. His mother is surprised he likes it so much, because she didn't think he would like the topic.

My nephews loved this book as a Christmas present.  Their parents report that they have to read every night for one or the other of their two sons.  Apparently, they both love it as they are active, curious boys (but I think girls would enjoy it too).  The pictures are lovely and the language is well-written with subtle rhymes.  I read it myself twice before sending it to them!
summary: A big hit with my nephews

reviewText: I would recommend this book to any little boy or girl that has an interest in construction equipment or as just a very good bedtime book.
summary: My three year old loves this story!

reviewText: Got this book to go with the little Tuffies Construction Trucks.  It's a very cute story and beautifully illustrated. My little nephews love this bedtime story.

We were in desperate need of an alternative to "Goodnight Moon"  -- okay I was in need of something new.  This gives us something else to read with the same idea.  We can still go through while we read and talk about all the cool things at the construction site, while talking about getting ready for bed.

I gave this book to several young children, and they all loved it. They love making things, and the book let them travel through a construction site. Like construction toys, they were very much into what the book was showing them.
summary: Great book for kids who love construction toys

reviewText:
Very cute book!!  My grandson just turned 3 and loves trucks, diggers, all construction equipment, tools,
lawn equipment, etc.  Loves his new book, cute story and great illustrations, too!!!!!
summary: Christmas gift for 3 year old grandson.

reviewText: My grandsons like trucks & the book they can relate to when going to bed as all things say "goodnight"
My 1 year old grandson likes anything with wheels.  The pictures are great.  It's a great naptime / bedtime book.
Purchased this for my almost 3-yr old grandson along with the construction worker play set. The book was a big hit and he loves to read it when he is in "character".
This is my two year old son's favorite book and it is sophisticated enough that he's bound to like it for years to come.  Well written and a pleasure to read to him.
My 3-year old granddaughter loved this one.  Cute story.  And they have made it possible to enlarge the words so you don't have to strain your eyes to read it to your child.  Would recommend it.
Ideal book for a 2-year old, great bedtime story.  Lots of things in the background that become noticeable after repeated reading, such as the moon, various tools, ditches, pipes, etc.
summary: best book ever for a an equipment lover

reviewText: I purchased this for a 3-1/2 year old boy.  He loves it!  He had me read it to him 3 times during bedtime.  I thought it would be a good book to put him to sleep but he is too entranced with all the big trucks!
I love this book.  So does our Grandson.

Every child should own this book.  My granddaughter loves it and I love to hear her point out heavy equipment, calling them by their proper names, as we are out driving.  It's a wonderful night time read.
Helps get kids used to the idea of putting diggers, scrapers, backhoes away and get quiet and ready for bed.
My 3 yr old loves this book. He wants to read every night. It's easy to read, and I pretty much know it by heart. Must buy for little boys (or girls) who likes cars and trucks.

Both of my kids love this book.  It is a great little story and has a great art style (the art style within matches what you see on the cover.)  As it goes over each construction vehicle finishing up some work and getting ready to go to sleep it always ends with a nice comfy "Shhhh, goodnight bulldozer, goodnight" or whatever the given vehicle is.  My kids love when we get to that part and say it with me in a nice sleepy whisper.  They use the real names of the equipment and my boys naturally have learned a couple of new words from it...for instance the boom on an excavator. Highly recommended.
Its one of the few that they always ask for as their good night story.  Fun for both my boy and girl.
summary: Great bedtime story for my 2 year olds.

reviewText: This a fun and colorfully illustrated book. Its a great accessory to any boys library. Its a great book fro story time.
My daughter who is 5 and my son who is 2 LOVE LOVE LOVE this book. it is so cute

We chose this book because he already had a on-line version. He very much enjoyed having the book in his hands to turn pages, and display to the adults. This was a good choice for his age group of 2.5 years.
summary: Review of Goodnight, Goodnight Construction Site

reviewText: This book put sparkle in my five-year-old grandson's eyes. He chooses it for those special moments of "Read to me, Grandma."
My great grandson is into any kind of construction piece, and this book covers all of them.  It tells how each of the pieces work and then go to sleep.
According to my daughter-in-law, this and My Truck is Stuck are my 3 year old grandson's favorite books.  He has them memorized!
Little kids often bestow personalities on machinery. This book lets them revel in that process, even unto giving each hard-working machine a bedtime process at day's end.
summary: For the 2-year old who loves construction machinery

reviewText: My grandson is 20 months old and loves trucks, all trucks, anything with wheels actually! He wants to hear this every night before he goes to bed! I ordered the authors book on trains for him today!
summary: Perfect "good night" story for little boys!

reviewText: Bought a second copy after my toddler loved the first to death. I also got it on kindle. My 2.5 year old rarely has the attention span for the whole book so I only read the first and last rhymes for each truck. I would like to have an abridged board book version. I'm sure this book will come around again and again as my child is ready to look further into the depth of words, rhymes and creative images. A mom and toddlers favorite.
summary: Great book. My toddlers favorite for weeks and weeks.

reviewText: This book is very much enjoyed by both my grandchildren, ages 3 and 18 months.  I will buy the other books in this series.
summary: Grandson and Grandaughter Love This Book

reviewText: This charming book absolutely fascinated my 2 year old nephew!  He loves trucks of every kind and seeing that they had to sleep too was amazing to him. It is his new favorite bedtime story.
summary: Great book for the truck loving child

reviewText: I purchased this book for my granddaughter, she loves it!  We have read it at least once every day for the past week.  The illustrations are nice and she likes to "read" the page with "shhhh, goodnight..." on it for each truck.  I am now going to purchase it in hardcover.  The best bedtime book we have had in a long time.  I would highly recommend this book.
My granddaughter loved listening to this story even if I bought the book for her infant brother. I am sure it will be one of those she helps me read as it will be a repeated story. So cute!
Good choice for toddlers that love trucks and colorful illustrations.  The book is charming and stuffed toys are available as well.
Gave this book to my nephew, 3 years old, and he loved it. He loves his trucks and tractor toys so it was a good fit.
Every time my grandsons are over they want this book read.  It is a favorite!  I highly recommend this book to boys who are into diggers.

My son is in construction so this was the perfect choice for a
grandson. He loves it and so do they

Purchased as a Christmas gift for my 2 year old grandson who loves trucks and construction vehicles.  We had to read it every night while he was here over the holiday.  It's one of those books you don't mind reading over and over.  Very cute!

Magic.  Tom Lichtenheld's oil pastels glow as if illuminated from behind.  Sherri puts several construction machines to bed, one at a time, and it couldn't be cuter.  No kidding. A very good pre-nap/bedtime read due to the subject matter and the illustrations are probably the best I've ever seen in a children's book (and I've seen a lot of children's books).  I've thought about buying a second copy and cutting out & framing the pictures--they are that good.
summary: One of the most beautifully illustrated books you will ever see.

reviewText: My 22  month-old grandson is fascinated by this book so we now have a 2nd copy for when he visits us.

This is a real hit with my two year old grandson who loves construction equipment.....he can name the various machines and does as we proceed through the book.  The illustrations are fun and the text moves right along as it should.

My son got this for Christmas, and we both really enjoy it. The story is very fun, but the pictures are just absolutely fantastic and are my favorite part. This is a great book for kids who are into construction equipment!

Our 5 year old got this as a Christmas gift and was really excited to receive it, even though it's not a toy. The story and illustrations are cute and keep him entertained and flipping pages back and forth. Any book that gets requested again and again is a 5-star in my book.
My boys love anything to do with construction and this is a MUST HAVE every night to read.  I loved the rhymes and the drawings are great.
A cute book for a construction lover!! My son is big into construction vehicles so this has been a big hit on our house!

My three year old loves this book! He asks for it every night and even tries to read along.  This is an adorable story that is sure to capture the attention of any toddler interested in construction!  It is just too cute!  Worth every penny!

My 22-month-old grandson is very much into construction vehicles.  I gave him this book because I was delighted by it, but discovered he already had a copy (which he likes).  No problem - the new copy stays at my house, the old one stays at his.

I got this for my son for Christmas and I think we've read it about 15 times already.  He loves it and I do to, the illustrations are great and the story is  cute.  I  will  probably buy this as a gift in the future for many of my sons friends and my nephews.
Do not at this time have any feedback as to how the youngsters in enjoyed the book.  I'm sure they liked the toy backhoes I also included.
summary: Goodnight Construction Site ordered for young boys in family.

reviewText: Cute for toddlers, especially for boys. Girls may not be as interested. Personally I don't love the style of the color, but overall it is still very good.
I am in the construction business, and my grand daughter always asked what happens when work is done. Well now she knows in a very enjoyable read.
summary: Great book for kids of all ages

reviewText: Bought this for my grandson who loves trucks; he is only 2 1/2 years old. So needless to say, this was a favorite.

Adorable bedtime book! Wish there were more!
Son loves to have this book read to him before bedtime.  Great for toddlers who don't want to go to sleep!
Here's another one my grandson has to be read to him every night.. It's the cutest book and I've never got tired reading it 365 days a year lol

I had to give this a 4 star rating because this was my 5 year old introduction to reading on a tablet. I think the reason he was not sold was because he is accustomed to reading hard copies. He likes to point at words and that is not possible on a tablet. Nonetheless, I loved it and would have given it 5 stars. This would definitely be a part of his online library.

My toddler son loves this book!  He has a lot of it memorized. It's very cute and rhymes well! My husband and I also learned a lot about the different construction trucks because of this book. Highly recommend! :)
The story was age-appropriate and interesting to read to children.  The illustrations added to the story line and the enjoyment of the book.
Perfect book for a little guy that loves "dirt diggers".  This should entertain a 3 year old for a long period of time

Such a good book - even my husband and I enjoy reading it.  And artwork is fantastic and eye catching.  At one point, I think this book was read to our 1year old about 20 times to get us through a trans-atlantic flight, we never left home without it.
summary: Son's favorite and favorite of many other babies I know!

reviewText:
Even if your child isn't an aspiring operating engineer, this is a really fun book for kids.  Get it, you won't be disappointed.

This is a wonderful book for boys and girls alike.  When my daughter was about two, there was a lot of earthwork going on behind our house.  She would stand at our second story window mesmerized watching the scrapers and bulldozer going around and around digging the pond, grading the streets and parking parking area.  Then at the end of the day the machines would all be parked and this book was a great way for her to relate to the machines.  My son also loves this book.  He is four now and will still choose this book quite often as one of his bedtime books.
This book is the perfect book for a child over 2 years old. My son is three and he wants to read it almost every night.
For any boy who loves trucks and any parent who loved Goodnight Moon, great book!!  Wonderful gift book, sure to be a classic.
This is my son's favorite book! I read it to him almost every night! This story makes him sleepy too. I think just talking about things going to sleep makes him yawn and feel tired.
Young, younger and those young at heart will love this book.  Let your imagination loose and enjoy the special time reading to those who can't.
Excellent rhythm and rhyme, clever and humorous, while still soothing and peaceful as a bedtime book should be.  It has been a long-time favorite of my truck-loving 3 year old.

My granddaughter loves any goodnight, goodnight book. Even though she loves all things princess, she loves to read and know about everything. She got a big kick out of this book.

It is nighttime, and at the big construction site, all the hardworking trucks get ready to say goodnight. One by one, Crane Truck, Cement Mixer, Dump Truck, Bulldozer, and Excavator finish their work and lie down to rest. The rhyming is one of the best, I have read.  The illustrations and artwork by Tom Lichtenheld brings the story alive. Colorful and creative, all of the construction equipment have personalities.
