The author, Sherri Rinker is a graphic designer and  said she is inspired by her two young boys. I have heard more positive comments about this book from the little toddlers who love it. Parents delight in reading it, also.

Recommended. prisrob 12-12-13
summary: The rhyming is one of the best, I have read

reviewText: THE best book for little boys!  We've been through 3 copies since he was 18 mos. old!  Great story and great illustrations!
Perfect gift for the little boy who loves wheels and big trucks. All sorts of heavy duty equipment join in the fun!
summary: Perfect gift for the adventurous boy.

reviewText:
Worthwhile, but not impressive.
I will find out after Christmas if a 3 year old boy likes it.
The print is a little small the illustrations are great.
summary: A good subject relative to times past.

reviewText: My 4 year old grandson has adored construction equipment since he was about 18 months old.  This book is perfect for him.
summary: Perfect for little boys who are fascinated by construction equipment.

reviewText: Great bed time read for any toddler that loves trucks. We read this book often and it's a new favorite among many. Would recommend.
Love this book so much.  Have bought it for ever baby, toddler, and young kid I know!!!  It's so cute and wonderful for naptime!
This is a charming book, which appeals to my three-year-old grandson. It is his favorite going-to-bed book and resides in his bedroom.
summary: A charming bedtime book for little boys

reviewText: Especially for little ones who like trains, busses, garbage trucks.  It has all the different types of large equipment you would find at a construction site.  The art work is great.
My boys both love this book and I don't mind reading it over and over.  Nice pictures of several of their favorite construction machines. Easy flowing paragraphs.
This is a great book for little ones who love construction vehicles! I enjoy reading this one to my son, day or night!
A huge hit in our house with my 4 year old son.  He loves construction trucks so this book is one of his very favorites.  It's a great bedtime story with cute illustration.
Almost three year old loves this book.  We have probably read it 100 times and he never tires of it.

My son turned five about two weeks ago.  He got a "Big Dig" from my husband's parents.  He sits on the seat and he can dig holes in the sandbox with the big, construction-like shovel.  All that is great, except he doesn't have a sandbox.  I set him to work on the weeds in the garden -- with rather disastrous results.

A few days after his birthday, my son received this book from a friend of mine.  He recognized the "Big Dig" right away, and immediately told me a story about a shovel and the moon and the stars.  The story is great.  The text is good, especially since it is a debut book -- the rhyming scheme goes off occasionally, but not irretrievably.  The illustrations, however, are phenomenal.

The illustrations have a wonderful retro feel; they are soft, but bright and friendly, and with a healthy dose of humor.  In all, my favorite kind of illustrations.

This book was given to my by a friend and I love reading the story to my nephew who is a big fan of cranes. Great for boys and girls who enjoy a good verse.Santa's on his way in time for Christmas Day

My 2 year old daughter loves this book! She is super girly so we try to balance her out with different types of books. She loves seeing construction sites now and she likes to learn more and more about how buildings are made, the materials and so on.
summary: Definitely recommend! A great read for girls also!

reviewText: My 7 month old is a little young for this book, it just doesn't keep is attention. I'm hoping it will in the future. The story is adorable.
Great book for 2 yr old grandson.  He'll love it!  Seriously into stuff like this, fun to read, and great illustrations.

We LOVE this book.  Very soothing, very hypnotic.  We really enjoy reading this to our son, we do not tire if it, and most importantly he enjoys listening to it!!  We read it several times through with a softer voice each time.  Gets him nice and calm and sleeeeeeepy :)
Great book for little boy who loves trucks and his own John Deere battery-operated tractor!  Right for his reading level in first grade.
summary: Good truck/equipment book for a little boy!

reviewText: My two year old nephew LOVES it!  My brother says it's the book that he always picks up before bed.
This is a Christmas gift for a little friend and I found the pictures cute and the book charming.  I am sure he will like it.

I have two year old twin boys, and they LOVE this book. The drawings are adorable, and the story is a nice length for their age. They like pointing out the truck's teddy bears, blankie, etc.  Very cute and sweet.
summary: Big hit with 2 year old truck lovers.

reviewText: This is my favorite book to read my 4 year old son at bedtime.  It's mellow, peaceful, just the right length.  He loves it, it flows well and makes us both sleepy.  Highly recommend it for ages 3-5.
Great book!  Kind of like Goodnight Moon, except with construction equipment.  My 2 year old wants us to read it 2-3 times in a row every night.
summary: If your toddler's into construction equipment, this is the bedtime book for you

reviewText: My husband and I both Love reading this book to 21 month old boy. Great bedtime book. He loves truck. And he has fun repeating the shhh as trucks go to sleep.

This book was our grandson's favorite book. Unfortunately, this grandma didn't get him his first copy and so we now have a lovely book for toddlers who love construction equipment that isn't being used. Guess we will give it to a "Toys for Tots" little one that might not have a neat book like this for Christmas.
summary: Great book for toddlers who like construction stuff

reviewText: Adorable pictures and cute story line. Each machine powers down after a day of work, and settles in for sleep. All of our kids loved this one, and we all really loved the illustrations! This would be a great book for a toddler or young child who really loves construction equipment...
summary: Lovely book, nice illustrations...kids all like story line

reviewText: Cute book for a boy who likes trucks and construction. Nice bedtime read. I found a shirt at Penney's that matched it perfectly (having trucks and equipment on it).

This book looks simple enough from the cover.  Wow, prepare to actually enjoy reading this children's book!  The rhyming is charming, the pictures are clever, and best of all- kids love it!  I got this as a gift for my 4 year old nephew and my 2.5 year old daughter is so in love with it that she is getting one for xmas too!
Great book. Nice bed time story. There are mad rhymes in here. My son enjoys this book. I enjoy reading it too.
I gave my nephew this book for his third birthday. My sister told me that it is now one of his favorite books.

Very cute book.  Love the rhyme and illustrations!  Enjoy the extras added to the illustrations such as teddy bears to snuggle with and nightlights for comfort.  Super!  This is a favorite read for my preschooler.

Beautiful illustrations and a sweet story elevate this book to the top of my little boys' (4 yrs & 18 mo) regular request list.  It's a hit with the little ones and I actually find it enjoyable myself as their dad.

Highly recommended!
summary: My little boys love Goodnight, Goodnight, Construction Site!

reviewText: My toddler daughter loves this book! This book is a very good choice for just before bedtime. The story is long enough to hold your child's attention, but not so long that I dread reading it every night. The illustrations are beautiful and playful with words to match. This book is good for boys or girls, and would make an adorable gift.
Love the cadence of this rhyming story.  An easy one for parents to memorize and recite when it becomes a child's favorite.

My 3 year old loves everything construction but has a hard time winding down fir bed. Imagine my excitement when I found this book. It has been the best addition to our nighttime routine. He loves the story and illustrations but I will warn that it can be a bit long for tired moms and dads after a long day.
Please warn the parent that he/she will be reading this every night for the next year!  Great animation and facial features on the vehicles.
summary: My new present for all three year olds!

reviewText: I have found that the greatest children's books are not the ones you fall in love with the first time you read them. The first few times I read this to my son, I thought it was "just okay". But now almost a year later, it has became a family favorite. One of the true signs of a great book is that the more you read it, the more you like it. Definitely a buy for any kid that loves trucks.
This one has nice rhyming/rhythms for bedtime reading.  Nice pictures too.  Great for my 2 year old grandson and one he will enjoy for awhile.

I bought this book for my son's 2nd birthday and he absolutely LOVES it. This is the first book he's wanted read over and over again, night after night. He has never stayed so intently focused on any other book I've attempted to read him. It's also an enjoyable book for me to read to him- I'm not yet tired of it after over a month of almost daily reading. The illustrations are wonderful and the book has a soothing feel. I've also learned the technical names for all the "big wellow trucks" my son gets so excited about when we're out driving. Overall, I HIGHLY recommend this book for any little kid who has an interest in the yellow construction trucks they see when you're out exploring :) Perfect bedtime story!
summary: First book to keep my 2 year old's attention

reviewText: My son and I love this book! The illustrations are fabulous and the book rhymes so well the story line is awesome for little boys who are fascinated with construction equipment.

This is a geat book about a construction site.  Love the story of different tractors going to bed and love the pictures of the different work that they perform.  This is my sons favorite tractor book.  I like it because it helps him unwind and get ready for sleep, just like the tractors get ready for sleep at the end of a day.  Buy this book!
This is a favorite within our home. We've read it so much we have it mostly memorized and often recite passages while in the car and pass a construction site.
summary: Fun goodnight story for any construction truck lover.

reviewText: We got this book for our son when he was 2, it's got quite a lot of text for a 2 year old so at that point we would just sort of make up the general gist of it. He's now 2.5 and LOVES this book, has memorized a lot of the text and asks for it at every bedtime. It's a great bedtime book for obvious reasons, everyone is tucked in and in bed so it's a good incentive for your little girl or guy to hop to it too! Be prepared to read it endlessly.
summary: Awesome for the little construction vehicle nut in your life

reviewText: As most toddler/rhyming books, some may be unbearable to read EVERY night, and MULTIPLE times a night, however this one is so sweet that I enjoy reading it.  Illustrations are lovely and it's the right length book where 1 time feels like enough.

My grandson (2) loves everything construction and knows already quite a bit about the different vehicles/machines and the purposes.  He loves this book with all the heavy equipment vehicles.  For wanting to be a big boy and tuff as the machines, he story and pictures are so sooting and sweet to him and also to me.
This book gave my grandson a jumping off point for his imagination. Now he says, "Good Night" to his trucks and trains before he's tucked in for the night.
This is worth the price!  One or two readings and my four year old is asleep! He loves this book.
A good quality made book. My grandson loves it. A very cute story. Good pictures and holds attention of little ones.
Well-written rhyming story with well-done illustrations. You and your little guy won't tire of this book very quickly. My daughter doesn't mind it either. Definitely worth buying.
summary: Very entertaining for our son who likes construction vehicles

reviewText: My 3 year old son loves this book. He has been having bedtime anxiety and this book helps calm him down before he goes to sleep. It is a really cute story with fun pictures and rhyming.

This is a sweet story with very well done illustrations.  My father worked in construction driving a bulldozer for most of his working life.  He passed away some years ago and never got to meet many of his great-grandchildren.  This book is a gift to one of them as a remembrance of him and an introduction of who he was to one of his great-grandson's.

This is a sweet story which I would give 5 stars to,  but would be better as a book.  I bought the Kindle edition but it will only display sideways in a double page spread which makes the page very small and the text so minuscule that even with magnifying glasses on you almost need a magnifying glass to read it.
There is no way to enlarge the text like regular books I have bought on kindle. That made it disappointing.
My grandson loves this book and has his mom read it to him almost every night along with his Richard Scarry books.
bought this for two small brothers who are absolutely enthralled reading it.  It calms and relaxes before bed.  If your kid loves construction vehicles, this book is for you.

Anyone with an ear for language or an eye for images will see that about 2 pages into the great concept of this book, the poetry begins to plod and the images stop aiming at any wit.  Every time I read it to my child it made me angrier at the missed opportunities in verse and image to make every page fresh and every line scan and show some wit. Though he loved construction vehicles at that time, he too became bored earlier than he would have done if this book lived up to the promise of its concept and its first pages.  An irritating dud and a lost opportunity of which writer and illustrator should be heartily ashamed.
summary: Hate to spoil the party-but one of laziest, lamest children's books

reviewText: What a pleasant surprise this book turned out to be. My 25 month old son loves this book and it really gets him primed for bed. We have a lot of books, but this is one of my favorites.
summary: Two year old loves this book! Perfect for bedtime.

reviewText: At times, this can sometimes be a bit wordy and drag, which changes the curve of when a child will most be interested in it. I'm thinking skewed towards much younger, as the drawings would seem to be of declining interest as the child ages, yet the amount and quality of the text is geared for slightly older (or considerably advanced) kids. That aside, the story is good, the cadence seems well-thought out and paced (if you're musically inclined, you can just as easily sing this book, in a variety of styles) and there is much to like about this book, though it is a touch on the pricey side.

We have read this book at least 3 times a week for the last year at bedtime. We let our son pick his bedtime book and he picks this one often. Even with its heavy use and that almost all of us have it memorized we don't mind reading it again and again. It's well written and the illustrations are fun. We actually just noticed a few more details this week!
My boys (2 and 4) quickly fell in love with this book and we went through a period where we had to read it every night before bed.  If your kid like construction vehicles, this book is a must!
Our 2yr old son LOVES this book - it preps him for bed & he feels good about going to sleep since all the Construction Trucks sleep too!

We read this book to our two daughters every night before bed. It's the PERFECT goodnight book. It's just long enough to let them settle, not too long (then they get antsy) or too short (then they are still wound up). The writing is easy to understand and brilliantly written. Each truck starts with a noisy, active description that then settles into quiet, calming words about falling asleep. So on every page the rhymes lull them just a bit deeper into relaxation. Seriously love this book, and so do my kids.
A good bedtime or nap time or anytime read. It's fun to read to the children and they like it, too.
Really love this little book!!  Great story and pictures!! Can't wait to give to much grandson for Christmas!!  He Loves Trucks!!
Grandson loves this book he is three and really into anything to do with construction vehicles and knows them all by name
We love this story.  It is a great bedtime story for heavy equipment and construction enthusiasts.  Nice story with good cadence.

My boys (4 &  2) absolutely LOVE this book.  I read it over and over and over again.  I will buy this for any truck-loving kid looking for a bedtime story.  Even I like it.  It's got a great rhythm and the pictures are great.
very good book talking about all the heavy equipments. the only thing though its sooooo big, but i manage ok.

Beautiful artwork, beautiful, slow rhythms, lovely soft rhyming - you could hardly conceive of a better bed-time book for boys. Little details are great, such as the excavator cradling the moon, the cement mixer sleeping with his little blanket, crane truck holding his teddy as he snoozes. There isn't the slightest flaw in this book.
He is a CARS fanatic and was excited with something new with machines! He loves to watch constuction near home and he could tie this in with the equipment he saw.
summary: Perfect for a two, almost three year old.

reviewText: I bought this as a birthday present for my son and he loves going through all of the tractors with me when I read it.  He's really into saying good night to the bulldozer!
This book is loved by my grandsons.  They enjoyed all the big construction equipment and hearing about their jobs.  A very relaxing for bedtime.
My two year old loves this book.  The rhyming words make it catchy and the cute illustrations of these big vehicles sleeping with a teddy bear/blanket make it extra child friendly.

I read to my grand children every night. Th 3 year old boy picks this one all the time. Th other kids also like it very much. Th only reason I am not giving 5 stars is because the text is small on the iPad so Nana has to strain a bit to see the words.
my two year old grandson loves it and likes to wear his construction hat when we read it at bedtime.
I like this book because of the pictures and the fact that my grandson loves it.  He has his daddy read it everyday.
summary: Great Book For Kids Who Like Construction

reviewText:
After reading my grandsons Goodnight, Goodnight Construction Site they all wanted to take the book home with them at the end of our vacation; so, I purchased two copies along with Steam Train, Dream Train which were delivered to their separate households.  The rhythm and cadence of both of the stories is a favorite of the grandkids and fun for the adults who read the stories.  I have been told that Goodnight, Goodnight Construction Site along wiht Steam Train, Dream Train have been a required reading each night since the grandsons received their own copppies of the books.

Thank you Sherri Duskey Rinker for and entertaining and loved story.
summary: A Fun and Loved Bedtime Read

reviewText: My daughter loves trucks and airplanes. Lets see how long that lasts, since all children toys, books and stories try to message that airplanes and trucks are not for girls. Guess how many female characters this book had? Zero. Yes, zero. Guess how many female main characters new Disney movie Planes has? One. And - yes - it's pink. So I guess sooner than later my daughter will learn that girls are supposed to play with useless pink princess costume crap and all the cool toys are for boys.
summary: Trucks and planes are not for girls

reviewText: When I gave this book to my daughter for her 2 year old triplet sons- she loved and - and so do they-- its become a nighttime ritual-- they love books-- especially Good Night Goodnight Construction Site!  Service and book were excellent--thanks
My son loves this book. He can name all the machines, and points out the little details he sees. Now he says "Good night" to his own little machines!

My son is obsessed with this book. He got it as a first birthday present -- and he's now 2 1/2 and the thrill of this book hasn't diminished. It is a super sweet bedtime story about trucks ending their day - with great illustrations and wonderful rhyming text. My son looks forward to bedtime in order to read this book. It is a great book - and a great gift. My only complaint is I wish it came in a board book version - so far my son has been very careful with the pages, but I hate to think of it getting normal wear and tear!

We first got this book from our local library.  My 3 year old feel in love with book from day one.  He wanted to read the book every night and could not wait to go to bed which normally is a fight.  He is also pointing out dump trucks and other contrustion equipment when we are on the road.  He says shhhh Mommy they are sleeping.  Great book!  We are buying a new copy today as the library book has to go back:(
For any construction-obsessed kid, this is a must have in your library! This book has great rhymes and lovely pictures.

My 6-year-old grandson enjoyed the story and pictures, and since he is at the age where he is recognizing words in print, it is a good book to reinforce early reading skills, while also introducing new vocabulary. I think children from about 3-6 years old would find this book entertaining and interesting.
My grandson thought this was the best.  He reads it every time I visit and now he is sharing with his baby sister.
This is one of my two year old grandson's favorite bedtime stories.  It is as much fun for me to read to him as it is for him to pick out and name all his favorite construction vehicles.

This book is chosen every night by both the 2 and 4 year olds. The drawings are beautiful and the story is sweet as the "rough and tough" construction equipment slow down and cuddle up for bedtime. The kids love learning the different equipment names and saying "Shh...goodnight, excavator, goodnight".

This is a pretty good children's book, but it has one major flaw: after it introduces each anthropomorphic vehicle, each one is put to bed; in other words, when each character is introduced, time reverses and the evening-to-nighttime progression is reintroduced. This is a disastrous formula if you are seriously trying to put a child to bed: you cannot keep going back to being awake-and-at-work--you've *got* to move slowly and gradually from consciousness to sleep, and thus to a FINAL NIGHTTIME. As it is, the book oscillates back and forth from awake to sleep, awake to sleep. This effect rubs off on the prospective somnolent child. The book should have introduced all the vehicles at first, along with their various tasks, and *then* set them each to bed--in two discrete parts of the book, as it were. Also, where is the bobcat? This is a grave oversight for any construction-site-loving child.

This is just the right  story for his age , nearly three. We have to read it to him almost every day
Before his nap . We all love it.

I just gave this to my not-quite-two-year-old twin grandsons, and they absolutely love it. They enjoy being read to very much, but have asked to have this book read to them far more than any of their other books. They enjoy every part of the book, but especially like the "Hey, pipe down!" page with the sleeping dump truck, and ask to see that one over and over. It's a huge hit.
The construction equipment illustrations are so real and humorous as well.  The little boys enjoy sitting and looking at the pictures in the book without adult attention.
summary: Grandson loves this book --- one of his favorite construction site stories.

reviewText: Our grandson loves big trucks - don't all little boys? - and this is one of his favorite bedtime books.  He knows all the names of the machines and can "read" along with us.  Great illustrations and text make it a "must" for these little ones!
My 2.5 year old boy has learned the names of all the construction crew and what they do. This is a favorite!
My son is a beginning reader and he LOVES this book!  He has enjoyed it and will continue to enjoy it for a long time.

This was part of a baby gift I gave to my newest grandson. Since his Dad is in the construction business I thought it would have a lot of meaning to my son and baby, however it would be appropriate for any baby.
The illustrations are beautiful.

My granddaughter gets read books every night at bedtime & this cute book can be added to her sleepy time reading.
.
My son will love reading this to his new daughter. The artwork is very good too. It will help calm her down for the night.

My son never tires of this book.  I think he has asked me to read it just about every single day since we received it from Amazon!  It covers so many of the trucks seen on a construction site that he loves!  And the illustrations are beautiful!
summary: 2 Year Old Enthralled with this book!

reviewText: Good story with gentle cadences that gently lull my 18 month year old to sleep..after playing with trucks all day, being put to bed by the same "friends" is the perfect ending to the day!
All little boys will love this book all about construction equipment.  I have given this book to many children and it is a favorite of my grandchildren.
Another great title for little boys. One of the best illustrated books we own, and a great one to read before bedtime. Definitely a must-have for little boys.
Our 2 year old grandson loved this book. There are many pictures of construction equipment and we had fun naming them. The color of the illustrations is very appealing.
An very good  night read for a very active 2 to 3 year old boy or possibly girl.  Even hard working "diggers" have to go to sleep.
I think it's cute, but my 17 month old grandson didn't like it. He likes the book with the thick pages he can turn himself. Maybe he will like it when he gets older.

This is one of our favorite books to read to our 3 year old. The story is cute and the illustrations are well done. This is a great step up after your little one is ready for something more lengthy than Goodnight Moon. This is my new go-to gift for baby showers.

Yea, they're stereotypes. But my granddaughter loves her Princess dolls and her little brother loves his trucks. And my little grandson really loves this book.

Funny, it's clearly written as a "good night" book, but he likes it when we wake him up from his nap! He asks for it (at least as well as a one and a half year old can ask for something). Besides seeing all the building machinery go to sleep, he likes to find the moon on the pages as we read. ("Moon" was one of his first words.) I think the poetry has a mesmerizing quality to it. I'm eager to get another by the author, who has a real nice touch. For my grandson, this is right up there with the Nancy Tillman books (which he and his sister both love.)
summary: Why do little boys love machines?

reviewText: This book has lovely illustrations and a great bedtime theme.  Both of my sons loved this book, as did several of their preschool friends.  This is a great gift (for your own kids or someone else's).
My son received this book as a birthday gift when he turned two.  It is such a great book, one of his favorites.  It is the perfect bed time book.

My son loves any cars, bus, construction vehicles, trucks...etc.
We read this book to my son so many times, now my son (2.5 years old) started reading this book on his own.
"tough...construction play. good night, good night."
I would recommend "my truck is stuck" if your kids like trucks.
clever story and beautifully illustrated.  I would buy again and I am glad we bought this one instead of taking it out at library.

My 2 year old son loves this book! He insists on reading it throughout the day. Not a car ride goes by where he doesn't point out a "she-mint mis-chur" (cement mixer), a "bull dosher", an "eschivator", or if he sees more than one machine together, a "construshion site"! My daughter would have loved this book if it were available when she was younger. She won't admit it, but she reads along as well, even though at six she already considers it a boy book.

I think the illustrations are brilliant and really holds my son's interest and attention. In fact, I think it is one of the better illustrated books out there.

If you are looking for a book for your son or daughter then you will surely be pleased with the impact this one has on them.

We bought this book for our 20 month old who is VERY interested in trucks.  We were slightly concerned about the length of the story and the fact that it's not a board book, but after the first read our worries were alleviated.  Our son loves the story, the illustrations are terrific!  This book became an instant favorite and our son has asked to read it multiple times a day.  Highly recommended.
The perfect bedtime story for the avid "big truck" enthusiast in your life.  Expect to hear "again! again!" every read!

This book has beautiful illustrations and nice rhyming couplets.  My children enjoyed it as a bedtime story.  I enjoyed it because it kept moving and was not too long!  It made nice use of sound words and had great opportunities to whisper and add inflection for the various voices.  Nice book for kids!
My son loves this book and we've been reading it to him just about every night since it arrived. The cadence is really nice.

I bought this for my 3-year old nephew's birthday as his dad (my brother) is an equipment manager for a concrete company and he lives and breaths this stuff. My nephew can name vehicles (loader, backhoe, skid-steer, etc.) like other kids name colors. In fact he's still working on colors but rarely names equipment wrong!  He loved the book, as did my brother.

Fantastic book!! Great story, amazing illustrations and easy for a parent to read. The rhythm of the story and the rhyming is just wonderful. It rolls of the tongue and is enjoyable. I love reading this story to my 3 year old, and he walks around the house quoting it.
summary: I would give it 6 stars if I could!

reviewText: My son got this book for his second birthday and it has been our go-to goodnight book ever since.  Our favorite part of this book are the illustrations by Tom Lichtenheld.  They are very beautiful, evocative images that conjure both the playfulness of the text and the "going to bed" theme of the book.  My only complaint about this book, and the reason that I cannot quite bring myself to give it five stars, is that the author's use of meter is very, very forced at some points, which just don't flow very well.  Still, the book is perfect for bedtime, story time, or any time a child wants to engage in the world of construction equipment.

My grandson knows the name of all the equipment in the book - and even had to correct grandma when she got one of the wrong. Great for any little one who loves construction and trucks and heavy equipment!
summary: He can name all the equipment

reviewText: This book is so CUTE! From the illistrations, to the way they are learning each machine, to saying good night and putting them to sleep. Will probably gift this book as well!
summary: My 3 year old daughter loves this book!

reviewText: Literally, all ages. I bought it for my grandchildren, and my husband, who is closer to 80 than he is to 70, loved it. He seldom picks up any of the children's picture books, but this one he read on his own and pronounced it excellent!  I think the illustrations are so well done, and it is one of those wonderful books that entertains, intrigues, and teaches all at the same time. It can stimulate the imagination of little ones playing with their miniature construction toys. Can't wait to give it to them, but will miss it when it is gone!

My four year old and one year old love this book! They like the rhyming and learning about all the different types of equipment on construction sites. The illustrations are great! Looking forward to getting "steam train dream train"

We love this book, how each piece of equipment is said 'Good night' to; and the concept that 'everything goes to sleep' Personally, I love and write rhyming books also; it creates a predictability for the young reader that gives some sort of mystical control, that they have a sense of a perceived outcome. Very darling illustrations too. Billy Book (Lollipop Flowers) ABC Animal Alphabet (Panda Phonics) Pudge Dog (A Fudge Adventure) I'm Hungry Animals (Hello Animals) Mr. Spider (Spooky Spook)

I don't think there's a better book for a toddler boy whole likes diggers, cranes, excavators and bulldozers. At the age of 2.5 yr my DS has had so much fun reading this book. After reading it to him for a few times, he simply memorized it and reads it several times a day, not just at night. Illustrations are great too!! LOVE this book!! A MUST HAVE in your toddler's book collection!!!
summary: THE BEST BOOK FOR A TODDLER BOY - HANDS DOWN

reviewText: Great book to read before nap & bedtime. My 3 year old daughter loves it! I like the illustrations as well.

I bought this for my 22 month old son.  He loves this book.  We have to read it 2 or three times in one sitting.  His favorite part is " Hey pipe down"!  Now when he sees that page he makes a face of anger and says it.  It has great pictures and a good story.
This book is a great book for going to sleep. Great pictures and rhymes.  It has all the machines and  is well loved.
I gather this book had to be read aloud 10x a day after it arrived. it was a big hit.
My truck obsessed toddler loves this book.  It's combines his favorite things: trucks and rhyming stories.  It's a cute little story with  anthropomorphic trucks going through their bedtime routines.
Well written, and awesome illustrations make the construction equipment look "cute" and "friendly.  My 3 year old girl loved this book at her daycare so much we had to have one for home.

Wow!  What a book!  Our six year old grandson loves it.  He decided he would be"Excavator Owen"  I (grandma) read it to him; then he reads it to me - if he isn't already asleep!

We are awaiting delivery of the "Steam Train" and the construction site board game.

Will there be other construction site books - like going through a construction project?
Very cutie with a sweet story line.  I enjoy giving books as gifts and this one was so darling, cute for any little boy.

This book has quickly become one of my 2-year-old's favorites! He is obsessed with trucks and this book is perfect for any truck lover. He asks to read it for almost every nap and bedtime story. I haven't gotten sick of it yet because the story is really cute and the pictures are truly beautiful! I'm so impressed, I plan to purchase the Steam Train version as well. I also like how it teaches you the names of several different trucks - cement mixer, crane truck, excavator, etc. - and what they actually do. Very cool! Now we point out specific trucks while driving in the car together.
This book was tedious and choppy to read with my son. I didn't really care for it and he didn't seem to care.

I gave this book to my grandson for his 3rd birthday. Mom or Dad had to read it as his bedtime story
every night for 3 weeks straight. He has been read to every night since he turned 1. So has a lot of books
to choose from...
summary: Great Goodnight book for any little on into trucks.

reviewText: My grandchildren love it.  A good story with good illustrations.  My grandson especially likes it.  The story is long enough to put them in the mood to sleep.

My nephew is 3 years old and totally obsessed with construction trucks. He has chosen to read this book every single night since receiving it three months ago. The illustrations are very well done and the story is just adorable. It reads fairly quickly which parents will appreciate at bedtime. :) It's the perfect bedtime story for any child who loves construction trucks.
summary: My 3-year old nephew won't put this down!

reviewText: Our grandson loves to have us read this book to him at bedtime.  It's a perfect good-night book. As the big equipment pieces wind down their day, so can the little nearly-three-year-old wind down his own.
summary: Goodnight, Goodnight Construction Site a Big Hit with Toddlers Who Are Into Heavy Equipment

reviewText: My boys love this book. Was bought for my 3 year old but my older boys sit around and listen too. Pictures are great and the story isn't too short or too long.
My 2 year old is obsessed with machines and he loves it. I love reading it because of it's clever poetry and great illustrations.
This is one of the best books for little ones who love "diggers".  It is quiet and sweet.  This is a good buy.
good rhyme, it has some neat rhymes and good story. i like the pictures and my son seems to enjoy it.
I purchased this for my 3 year old grandson who loves construction trucks. The story is delightful and the illustrations are perfect for a young child.

If you have a boy who loves to watch and play with dump trucks, front end loaders, or the like, you need this bedtime book. We bought it for our three year-old grandson and he is ga-ga over it. The rhythmic account of bedtime preparation for the cutest construction big boys you ever saw is enough to make me yawn. Oh, wait, I'm a grandma, and I'm actually sleepy at bedtime.

This book is rare .  I love it because it really works  putting my little boy to sleep.  Thank you so much for writing a bedtime book about constriction.  His dad works for a constriction company and he may like this book as well.

Bringing life to the various construction equipment, this is one book my husband doesn't feel silly about reading.  It is a nice book to introduce to the bedtime routine.  Use the look inside option at the top where the picture of the book is to sample.  I think this is a staple for any little boy...or girl...but mostly boy's library.  The best part of the day is saying goodnight with your child and a routine book.
summary: My husband's choice of manly book for baby- lol

reviewText:
Its a book that will be in the home library for many years and hopefully will go with them as they have their own family.
I think this would be especially good for little guys that are thrilled to see them at work.

The rhymes are clever and fun to say out loud. It really is a pleasure to read. My son enjoys the book too. Some books I dread to read over and over, but this one is cute every time. Illustrations are detailed too.

My 3yo son received this gift for Christmas and has asked for it almost every night since. He is fascinated by all the work going on at construction sites (who isn't?), so this is perfect for him.
My only complaint is that I wish they had written "concrete mixer" instead of "cement mixer."

I was browsing the Amazon top 100 books and was surprised to see Good Night Construction Site in the list but I wasn't. My 5 yesr old boy _loves_ it and so does his 7 yr old sister (who is more partial to "The Very Fairy Princess" books. Our kids see that different members of the same team all have different abilities that are all needed and all need rest.
summary: All have a purpose and need rest

reviewText: The graphics and text content and rhythm create a calming environment, even for children who are still full of energy at the end of the day to go to sleep. My child seems to identify with each construction vehicle and its hard workday and then readiness to sleep.
summary: Creates a calm environment conducive to sleep

reviewText: My 2 year old loves this book and asks for it by name at bed time.  Great if your kid loves construction vehicles.
I got this for my grandson who loves books.  He loves construction equipment and the story personalizes the equipment to allow the child to identify the personality of the equipment.

Our other grandson spends many wonderful hours playing with all manner of construction toys that delight many boys. This lovely book is the ideal companion for him as he approaches bedtime each evening....
Wonderful introduction to construction elements for a young child; my grandson loved it. Easy to read and understand. Great buy.

I bought this book for my friend's baby shower after hearing some good reviews about it. I liked it because it is somewhat similar to Goodnight Moon, a bedtime classic when I was younger. When I received it, I had to read it myself. The story line makes this a great book to read to your kids before they go to bed. Wonderfully illustrated! Teaches a little about all of the uses of the construction equipment. I would have loved this book when I was a child.
This is a bedtime staple for our 2 year old - he asks for it by name. Great easy to read story helps him wind down and outstanding illustrations.

Any child will love it.
An absolute favorite with my grandson who loves all the big equipment used at construction sites.
Grammy
My two grandsons each got a copy and as a result of how much they enjoyed it ,both my daughters subsequently purchased copies to gives as Christmas/birthday presents to friends of the children

I have two girls under 6, and I bought this on a lark for my entertainment during story time.  However, my girls just love it.  We read it every night for the first week, and now it's a regular in the rotation.  The pictures have little gems like the crane's teddy bear that the girls love to point out.
summary: Bulldozers are not just for boys

reviewText: This is one of my two year old son's favorite bedtime books. Most of our other goodnight books feature animals, so this is a nice alternative. My son LOVES anything and everything trucks, so knowing that the trucks are going "nanight" makes his bedtime routine that much easier! We enjoy reading this book as a family, and the pictures are just fantastic. The book highlights each individual truck as they wind down for the day, go through their own bedtime routines, and get tucked in. My son says "nanight" to each one before turning the page. As each new truck gets tucked in you can see the other trucks already asleep as shadows in the background, which my son also likes to point out! The rhythm is perfect, as well as the length of the book. The variety of trucks is perfect hitting on all of my sons favorites (excavator, bulldozer, dump truck, cement mixer and crane truck). It's also educational since it introduces each truck with the type of work that they do, and uses correct terminology when referring to specific parts of the truck (i.e. the cement mixer's chute and crane truck's boom). Overall an amazing book!
summary: There's a reason this is a best seller!

reviewText: Picked this one up for my 2 1/2 year old little girl. It has a re-occurring theme describing the names and functions of several construction vehicles, and of course saying goodnight to them. Great for little ones who aren't quite able to read, but memorize. Illustrations are also top notch.
My kids (2 and 3 years old) LOVE this book. They are very into construction equipment so they get a kick out of this. Love to read it every night.
A little long for night reads, but great story, graphics are great, my 3 year old grandson loves it. Over priced it you only have one kid, know chance to recycle a great book.

I read this before sending it as a shower gift for my expected Great Grandson.  I thought it was a nice book, and since my Grandson is in construction thought it was appropriate!  I found it recommended on a children's site I went to and bought it because it was highly recommended.  Since that time, I have realized what a favorite it is now.

my 28-month old son loves all things that go "brrrooom"  - so I thought this would be a pick hit for bedtime.  It is.  The best part, he now knows the names of the various vehicles we see at construction sites and will call out "look a crane"
My Grandson loves this book it is a perfect bedtime story and it has beautiful illustrations that he never tires of looking at.
If you don't own this, you should. The rhymes and the illustrations are marvelous. You will read it every night
I got this as a gift for my daughter's friend. The illustrations are great, and I found them really entertaining.
I purchased this for my 2 year old grandson's birthday. He loves it! He is always asking to have it read to him. A great purchase.

I had the opportunity to read this book at a friend's house to their son and I loved the easy rhythmic pace and how each two page format was focused on each type of construction vehicle. The little boy loved it, I ended up buying 1 for my grandson's classroom library and a couple more for my grandson and nephew. I really enjoy reading it at bedtime and nap time as it has the pace of Goodnight Moon where it quiets even the youngest, "I'm not sleepy yet" down for a peaceful slumber.
This book is great for little boys who love mighty machines.  My grandson loved it, and he loves most anything to do with mighty machines.
Sweet book for any construction work lover. Beautiful images and creative rhymes, I'm sure to read it to my son many times.

I first sampled this on my kindle, and my two year old son was mildly interested. I decided, I would love to have this in his library anyhow, and ordered it. I have always liked book form books better anyway. It arrived and we snuggled in that night and he was so involved in all of the characters. I love the way the author uses the construction vehicles parts to convey sleepytime. The crane truck pulls in his boom....and my son loved the teddy bear in the "arms" of the truck. He also loved that one of them slept in a dirt bed. I recommend this highly! I love to give books as gifts, and will be ordering again for this purpose.
My kids and I love this book! The words are engaging, and the pictures keep us exploring. Good quality paper as well, still havn't ripped the pages...
I bought this book to provide a very "boy" type story for my grnadson.  As he loves to play with his baby truck and watch his dad's remote control truck, I thought the story would interest him, too.
summary: My grandson and I love the images in this book.

reviewText: This book was purchased for our three year old who is very much all boy.  He LOVES tractors, trucks, tools, etc.  My son loves to read this book and point out each tractor, truck, etc.

This is one of the best children's books in our collection.  Our son has, since he was old enough to recognize big machines, been fascinated with trucks, tractors, and construction vehicles.  My house literally looks like a work site because we own at least one of every kind of construction vehicle imaginable (except a pile driver, which we are currently looking into).  Needless to say, when I saw this book, I knew he would enjoy it.  What I did not expect was that my husband and I would also look forward to reading this one.

This book is beautifully illustrated; each truck is drawn in detail and given faces and personalities that little ones can appreciate.  The writing is solid; the language is age appropriate without feeling as though the author is talking down to the child.  The rhythm flows and tells a great story of construction machines getting ready for bed.  My son has his favorite pages, of course, including the owl on the cover page ("Mommy, what's he doing sitting up there?") and the page where Dump Truck snores himself to sleep and a man hollers out a window to Pipe Down!  ("He's grumpy, isn't he, Mommy?")

Our son has a virtual library of books, but this is one that gets rid several times each week.  Even if your child isn't as fascinated with construction machines, this is a book that should be a part of your child's collection.  Five stars and then some.

This book quickly became our toddler's favourite bedtime book.  It is beautifully illustrated and it is written in a calming sing-songy rhyme scheme that makes it perfect for unwinding at the end of a long day and getting ready for bed.  Our toddler loves to point out the various pieces of construction equipment and he kisses each one good night as each piece of equipment retires to bed for the night.  It is a delightful book, and one of the few books that I don't mind reading 5 times a night.
My 6 year old loved it. We picked it at random because he likes construction vehicles. Beautiful pictures. Nice rhymes.
Beautiful illustrations, great story line. We read it to our son at night. Bought it for my nephews who now request this book at night too.
Glad to add this to our book collection.  My husband is a diesel mechanic so it's. pretty cool because of that too.  Our girls enjoy this book.  I'm sure baby brother will grow up to love it too
This is a nice book to read to any child. It is very well written and the illistrations are outstanding.
I LOVE this story!  My 2 year old son loves it at bedtime.  He says "night-night" on the right pages and really gets into the story.  This is a great bedtime story!

Once I read the reviews on this book, I knew I had to buy it as a goft for my son's construction themed bday. We read the book every night, I love it and most importantly so does my son! It is such an adorable book and I will definitely be purchasing it for gifts in the future. Highly recommend to others...you won't get sick of reading it. Looking forward to the new book coming out as well!
I clever rhyming book that is perfect for little boys who love construction equipment.  A joy to read to him.
summary: My grandson's favorite bedtime book and mine also.

reviewText:
lots of learning
lots of pictures
relevant and easy to follow - very thoughtful book - i recommend it to everyone who has a 2-4 year old kid
Somewhat of a spinoff of BB, the Builder, this cute little book would make any little boy settle down for bed.
This was a gift for my nephew and for my brother who worked construction.  They loved this book thought it was cute.

bought this for christmas for my almost-4 year old cousin, along with a construction hard hat & some construction trucks, and it made for a suuuper cute gift. the story is adorable & fun to read aloud.
I'm sure its a good book, but it is still a little over my grandson's head.  But the book was in great shape and I'm sure he'll like it a lot when he's a year older.
summary: Great book for 4 year old boys

reviewText: My grandson loves this book and had to have it read to him every night. I love it when we are out during the day and he sees a construction site and knows all the large equipment.

The kids love this book.  They enjoy the story, though the artwork is as captivating.  Each page draws readers into the work at the site, and a gently diagrammed process of how it's done.  Great fun for little deconstructionists and future engineers!  In a sea of commercial children's books, this one is unique and a keeper.

This book is a favorite in my household. It is the most requested bedtime book by my toddler. It has cute rhyming and storyline. The pictures are an attention grabber for my toddler. This is so popular with friends and relatives kids as well. My toddler loves it so and I guess because we read it so much he finds it comforting. It helps to relax him and get him ready for bed. This book was a great addition to our at home library.
My son who is crazy for excavators and trucks LOVED this book! It rhymes well, pictures are big and cute. Absolute favorite of the month!
summary: A toddler boy's dream construction site

reviewText: I gave this book to my nephew for his 3rd birthday and he loves it.  My sister told me it is his new favorite bedtime book.
My great-grandson loves this story, and of course insists on hearing it over and over again. Cute illustrations, and a wonderful bedtime read.
summary: Very cute book for little boys!

reviewText: boys love it....trucks are their favorite thing.....want to read it every night. would recommend to other grandparents to keep at their house
My 7 year old loves this book still after a year. It is super cute and is a great book to do reading comprehension with. I believe it is also an AR book. I highly recommend even for girls!!

This book has been an immediate hit in my home - twin girls and an older boy all love it. The illustrations are interesting and provoke questions, the rhyming text is fun (and can be shortened to a couple of stanzas without losing the plot on the next page if babies want to turn the pages quickly too!).
summary: From 18 months - 3 yrs - the kids love it

reviewText: 3 year old grandson in love with construction anything. we drive to construction sites and he just wants to park and just sit and look at the equipment, even if they are done for the day. this was a very nice book for him
My husband works on heavy equipment so the kids love this book.  It says good night to all the machines on the work sight.  Very cute story and pictures.

My two year old son adores this book. It's very lyrical and nice to read aloud. The pictures are beautiful. He especially loves the picture of the truck snuggling the bear. I'd highly recommend it for anyone with a child (boy or girl) who's interested in trucks.
summary: My two year old loves this book!

reviewText: My young daughter loves books about trucks and machinery, and this book is a wonderfully beautiful take on that popular theme.  A peaceful book for nighttime reading, with beautiful illustrations.
My 4-year old son loves this book.  He loves how all the different construction vehicles are described.  For being about construction vehicles, it is very calming.

This is a fabulous book!  It is my 3 year old son's absolute favorite.  He pulls it out every evening for me to read it to him.  He is very into construction and "digger trucks" and this book is wonderful with great illustrations and a lovely bedtime story as all of the trucks get ready for bed after busy days at work.  It is the perfect bedtime story for someone who loves trucks.  We love it!
My two year old grandson who loves trucks & tractors enjoys this story at bed time and helps him fall fast asleep!  A very cute bed-time story for little boys.
summary: An very cute bed time story

reviewText: It is very nice, my grandson got 3 of them for Christmas!  I had to return mine since he didn't need all of them!
My grandson had this book already so I gave it to my neighbor's little boy.  His dad read it to him most nights and he liked it very much.
summary: I gave this to my neighbor's little boy and he loved it.

reviewText: Definitely my two-year-old, now three-year-old grandson's favorite book.  He can recite the words himself and "reads" it to others.  Since he loves trucks and big equipment movers (like those working construction in his neighborhood), he really loved the book.
This is my 3 year old's favorite book. It has great graphics and is nicely written. It has quickly become a favorite bedtime story.
summary: Wonderful book for children who love construction equipment

reviewText: My son works in construction with big equipment and he's away from home all week during the summer & fall, so I got this book so his little daughter would know what he does during the day when he's at work.  VERY CUTE little book.  Great for learing about construction equipment, great for kids who love trucks & big wheels, and great for a bedtime book!
We bought this book for our almost-4-year-old grandson.  His main area of interest right now is trucks.  He loves this book, and wants to read it every night before he goes to bed.
My grandson loves this book. We purchased the book to give to him as a Christmas gift. The story rhymes, which is fun to read aloud and the illustrations are lively and interesting to look at.
summary: For a little boy who is crazy about bulldozers

reviewText: This book is great for kids who like rhyme and, above all, construction vehicles!  Cute illustrations add to its appeal.

This is such a tender book for bedtime. My grandsons love looking at the pictures as I read them to sleep.
I would not recommend a kindle version as the young reader needs the experience the 'look and feel' of
a book to develop an interest in reading.
Absolutely a favorite bedtime book!!
My 2 yr old boy loves this book and my 5 year old daughter memorized every page! Must buy for every toddler preschool household.
My son and I both love this book. I read it to him pretty much every night before bed. It is very well-written with excellent imagery. A must-have for any child who loves the big machines!

For a picture book that will help children understand their bad dreams, see Mommy, Daddy, I Had a Bad Dream!

reviewText:
My son loves this book. It has some length to it, but it manages to keep my 2 year old's attention well. He sometime even requests it more than one time a night. I like the flow of the story and the photos.

There is one error though. 68% (93 of 133) of the way through. On the page it states "Shh...goodnight, Excavator, goodnight." However, on the next page it repeats the SAME sentence. When reading, I just skip over the first one, but I really wish there was and update to fix this.

reviewText: One of my favorite books. It's sweet, perfectly written and the illustrations are adorable. My little guy notices the little teddy bear and blanket and giggles every time. I've purchased several for friends. This is a classic!

My son screamed with excitement at all the trucks.  Well written, clever wording, rhyming and easy to read and engage the young child. A crane! Rocks! Dirt! The moon! He loved it!  It is not easy to get anew book in the night time rotation, but this broke right in!

One of life's mysteries--why is it that every toddler boy I know is crazy about construction machines? This book fits the bill perfectly--but (when you get tired of reading it for the 20th time) also check out WHAT CAN A CRANE PICK UP? by Rebecca Kai Dotlich with ADORABLE illustrations. For instance, the train isn't empty--it's full of animals including a Lyle the Crocodile lookalike--and the smiling face of the crane will make you feel happy (guaranteed). So terrific to have books like these to instill a love of rhyme in the youngest listeners!
summary: Why do kids love CONSTRUCTION machines?

reviewText: Colorful pictures and wonderful rhymes bring construction equipment to life for both the reader and the kindergarten listener.  Having a father in the construction business and having seen some of the equipment first hand may have helped the 5 year old's attention span, but the vivid illustrations give life and personality to each piece of equipment.  Next time I visit I'll have the 3rd grader do the reading and get yet another chance to enjoy the book myself.

reviewText: This book is my favorite of all my (2-year-old) son's bedtime books. The writing is entertaining, and the illustrations are charming. There's good rhyme, but it's not too sing-songy. This is sure to be a new classic. I certainly hope Rinker continues writing!

I grabbed this book at the library on a whim.  They had it propped up on top of the a shelf in the children's section, and I grabbed it thinking it might the good for bedtime reading with my almost-3-year-old boy.  I was not disappointed.

The illustrations grab your attention first.  They are beautiful renditions of a cartoony construction site where the trucks and and other equipment are the workers.  The coloring in the pictures looks like colored pencils, so there is a lot of texture and color gradient.  I love them.  My son loves Crane Truck's teddy bear and star-shaped night light, and the faces that Cement Mixer makes during his work day.

I was surprised that the story is a poem.  It's hard to pull off a good poem with strong rhythm and rhyme that young kids can wrap their minds around, but Sherri Duskey Rinker does a very good job.  Each page holds true to the meter that starts on page one and extends to the end of the book.  I was impressed at how easily the words flow when read aloud.  And the "sound effects" that each piece of equipment makes are fun to add in.  (My son likes the bulldozer's "rooaaar" in particular and won't let me skip it.)

Sherri Duskey Rinker also does a wonderful job of personifying the construction equipment.  They take on the humanoid actions of working, closing up shop, and going to bed.  The beautiful illustrations only help to add to this delightful representation.

And the work described is true to life, as well.  Sherri Duskey Rinker explains in simple, easy-for-young-minds-to-understand form the work that each piece of equipment performs in the real world.

Over all, this is a wonderful book that I would like to buy for my son.  It will grow with him, and one day he'll be able to read it to me and--maybe--his own son.

The text is EXTREMELY small for the kindle fire edition. Not happy with this. Amazon needs to step up to the plate and start correcting these problems. This is not the first kindle book I purchased for my kindle fire that the text is small.....to the point of being barely readable.  When you have a toddler that is learning how to read, small text is useless.  Not happy with Kindle Fire edition.

he calls it constructyum fun

A wonderful way to settle down your truck-loving dreamer.

Just like little boys, trucks and cement mixers and bulldozers work hard all day and when the sun begins to set, it is time to settle in for a nice relaxing night.  As you turn the pages, you see the hard work that all the trucks at a construction site do and as the day comes to an end, they curl up and sleep until the sun rises again.

Told with a slow and even pace, you little guy can see that everyone has to turn off their engines and settle in for a good night with big dreams.

My favorite thing about this book is that it can be read in portions so it never gets too monotonous.  The book is broken into an overall intro to the construction site needing to go to bed, followed by each individual type of construction vehicle going to bed, and an ending to the entire construction site with all of the vehicles asleep.  Each night you can literally read the intro and finale with one vehicle put to bed in between without ruining the overall feel of the book.  This reduces monotony and frees up time to read a different book first.  It also leaves some anticipation on the kid's part because they never know which truck you will read about that night.  Also if you are more into reading the book from start to finish, and a kid looks really sleepy, you can easily skip to the end and be done faster.  Some kids will catch on to your skipping portions of the book, but if they are really falling asleep they should not wake up.
summary: Can Read In Portions so never gets Monotonous.  Easy to skip to the end as well.

reviewText: This is a new classic in our home. My oldest son got this in his Easter basket and loves it. He is all about trucks and "working", so this is the perfect bedtime book. I'm sure we will read this for years to his younger siblings as well. The illustrations are very cute and colorful.

Just a great all-around bedtime book for any little that likes machines (and even for those who don't)!

My son loves cars, trucks, construction vehicles and basically anything with wheels so I thought this book might be a hit since we were getting bored with his short goodnight story board books.  This was a much bigger hit than expected!  The pictures are great - each vehicle is, believe it or not, "cute" - and my son loves to learn each one's name.  The rhyming text is very soothing and my son, who is still several months shy of 2, will sit still for the entire book even though it is fairly long for his age.  Highly recommend!

This just may be my favorite book yet for children b/c they interact with it & look forward to pages & saying words w/ you.  I don't know what it is about this book, but it is wonderful.  It really helps w/ the bedtime routine too.  To tell each construction vehicle goodnight is very smart.  It even utilizes words like it's time to turn off the lights, relax, yawn, tuck in, basically all words associated w/ it's time to go to bed in a good way.  To have each page reiterate going to bed slowly builds to it being time for you to go to bed just like the book.  Smart!  The pictures are adorable & are perfect for the words on the page.  Kudos to the author for the line each time repeating "shhhhh.....goodnight, ___ (whichever vehicle your saying goodnight to on that page), goodnight".  They love to say it w/ you!  Just adorable.  I only have good things to say about this book.  I HIGHLY recommend especially if your children enjoy dump trucks, front loaders, cranes, excavators, etc.

What is not to like about this book?  It has simple and cute rhymes about different types of trucks PLUS very nice illustrations. Our 2 1/2 year old son absolutely loves this book. He asks us to read it to him twice before going to bed, participating in the reading process (he memorized rhymes).  He also looks at the pictures very carefully, which (I think) are just adorable (example: one truck holds a teddy bear).  It is very hard to find books that keeps the attention of 2-3 year old.  He also likes "Sometimes I like to curl up in a ball," the Biscuit series, SOME BOOKS from Llama Llama series, and "My truck is stuck" (my least favorite due to awkward rhymes).
My son received this book when he was about 2 years old and it continues to be favorite. The story is enjoyable to read and there are lots of interesting details to talk about in the illustrations.

My two-year old son is obsessed with construction sites and heavy machinery, so I bought this to show him that even big, strong trucks go to sleep at the end of the day. He adores this book and gives each machine a kiss goodnight on the page as they snuggle in for the night on their dirt "pillows." So adorable, and I don't mind reading it again and again. And again. The illustrations are amazing too.

A wonderful book that is now part of our evening routine.

Illustration is beautiful, pages are stronger/more durable than typical children's books, and the story is lovely. Our little one loves to say goodnight to each construction vehicle, and just loves the details on each page (one vehicle has a teddy bear, another has a blanket). The repetition of "goodnight goodnight" for each vehicle is a very calming and child-friendly way to reinforced the night time message.

The pace, story, and rhythm of this story are all fantastic!  Love this book!
summary: Wonderful part of our evening routine!

reviewText: A beautifully illustrated construction site story for kindergarten. It will keep the boys reading and rereading this book over and over again.

My 2 year old adores this book.  We got it 3 days ago and have read it, seriously, at least 8 times since then.  We read it 3 times as soon as we opened the box.  Oh, we might be going on 10 actually.  He even asks to go upstairs to his bedroom to read it in the middle of the day and it helped calm him down when he was upset.  Now it's our current bedtime book (in addition to Scarry's What Do People Do All Day) and he doesn't show any signs of getting bored.
Adorable,great pictures. My son who doesn't like to sit still for books (but loves diggers!) asks for this to be read over and over at bedtime. We both enjoy it!
summary: Great for bedtime for rambunctious child that loves "diggers"

reviewText: We bought this book as a gift and just received it yesterday.  Last night we read it to our kids (ages: almost 4 and 7.5).  They loved it and we did too so we plan to reread it several times before we have to give it away.

A must have for young children.  My son and daughter both love this book!  The illustrations are so cute and the details to nighttime routine are spectacular.  My son loves that the crane truck has a teddy bear!
summary: A must have book for boys, even girls!

reviewText: My three year old grandson loves this book. It is a nice replacement read for Good Night Moon especially for children who enjoy trucks and are curious about building sites.
summary: Good Night Good Night Construction Site

reviewText: We took this book out from the library and what a find! It is so adorable we just had to buy it! My 2 yr old absolutely loves this book. The storyline is great, not too little or too much and has some great details to it. This is a great book for any child ages 18mths-5, especially kids who love trucks. We're very happy!
summary: A must have for your toddler

reviewText:
This quickly became our 3 year old's favorite book. He asks to read it every night and is able to
recite many of the words.

My son has always loved books - and I have read many, MANY of them to him, since he was just a few months old.

So when I say that he choses THIS book over every other one in our collection, it really is the highest praise I can give. We also have (for instance) The Gruffalo and The Goodnight Train (and about 100 other fantastic stories) but at this point in time, none of them trump this fantastically written story.

I think the length is great too - a lot of the other stories are so short but this one feels just right - just long enough for him to calm down at the end of a busy day.

Last night my son recited the first FOUR pages of the story back to me word for word - it was one of the proudest moments of my life! And I can't think of any higher praise for the story from my son than him trying so hard to memorise it :)

You cannot go wrong if it is for a boy (my niece didn't love the pictures, LOL, but the boys LOVE it)
summary: my 2.5 year olds FAVOURITE STORY EVER

reviewText: My little boy is obsessed with anything that has wheels!  He loves this book, and I do too.  Great little story, and great pictures.  Would definitely recommend!
summary: Great Book for A Child who Loves Trucks and construction!

reviewText:
My angel is 5 and this book is number one to be read all of the time. We read this book during the day and at night and he loves to hear good night to each of the machines. The animation is captivating as he finds new questions to inquire about the machines each time we read the story.

 He has made up his song for the cement truck because in the story the cement truck has his song in which the author did not give us the song per se but allowed the child to create their own song. He took the Hokey Pokey song, changed the lyrics to match what a cement truck does. lol Soooo cute!!!

If your child loves construction vehicles and machinery, then this book is for YOU!

My mother purchased this as a Christmas present for my son.  I was skeptical as it was clearly following in the steps of Goodnight Moon.  However, it is unique enough to be refreshing and interesting.  My son requests it before nap and bedtime.  It has expanded his vocabulary.  Even I know now that his truck is not merely a truck but an "excavator." He also loves the detailed illustrations, pointing out the man yelling "Pipe Down" each time we read it.  Pretty soon he'll be telling his baby brother to "Pipe Down!!"

I hadn't heard of this book but saw it on sale at the store. I flipped through it and was impressed by the charismatic artwork. With a four year old fascinated by anything with wheels, I thought it would be a good addition to our collection of bedtime books. I read it to him that night and he sat mesmerized by the entire story.

The rhyming story tells a wonderful tale of all the trucks in the construction site getting ready for bed. With gentle sounds and repeated phrases, this book is just wonderful for kids who have outgrown Goodnight, Moon but still need or want a book to lull them to sleep. I will be looking for more books by this author and illustrator.

The images in "Goodnight, Goodnight" are beautiful, and the story line is simple but fun.

Our two year old son got this book for Christmas, and has asked us to read it to him pretty much every night since.  Parents will like it as well, since it doesn't get annoying after the 100th time reading it, and it helps calm and prepare your child for bed.  Highly recommended!
summary: Our two year old loves it

reviewText: My little boy (18m) loves trucks and trains and just adores this book. It's such a great goodnight story and it's the perfect length. My son BEGS for this book at night.
summary: Finally, a goodnight book without bunnies or puppies

reviewText: My husband ordered this book for our son, and he wants it read to him multiple times a day.  The ryhmes make the text flow, and it's enjoyable for both of us.  Great illustrations, too!
summary: Perfect for my Truck-obsessed 2 year old

reviewText: I bought this book for my son's first birthday. It is GREAT!  It would be a super cute gift to give along with some construction truck toy. The illustrations keep my son's interest. The writing is well done. There is a page for each different construction vehicle that starts in the day, describes the machine's daily tasks and ends by saying goodnight to the vehicle. This book has become on of our favorites!

I got this book for my 2 year old who loves trucks. It is wonderfully written, and the pictures are beautiful. I love the truck who cuddles a teddy bear to sleep in the picture. So cute! I liked it so much that I didn't want it to end-I wanted more verses with more trucks! My son wants the trucks to all wake up in the end, so we're hoping for a "Good Morning" sequal. Even so, he's asked for me to read it again. This will be in our daily rotation for sure.

My son and I just love this book. The rhyme is very good, the wording is concise, and the repetition makes it a good choice for pre-nap or bedtime reading. The illustrations are a great match for the text, and very much enhance the story. Each of the construction machines is personified and given a bit of character that youngsters can identify with. There's even a little red bird on most of the pages that my son likes to find and point out. Great book that's a new favorite in our book-loving house.
summary: Great rhyming story with fantastic illustrations

reviewText: This is such a cute story and I would love to have it in the print version with the large pictures for my son to see easily. Unfortunately the Kindle version has the smallest pictures I've ever seen for a childrens book. I'd love to get reimbursed and delete the book!!!!!
summary: Cute story but HORRIBLY small pictures

reviewText: I gave this to my nephew as an early Christmas present last night and this was his response: 1. He pulled off the paper cover, saying, "we don't need that;" 2. He made us read it four times (we took turns); 3. After studying each page again, he took it to bed with him, where his grandmother read it one more time; and 4. He took it home with him this morning because, and I quote, "I want to read it every day."
summary: Great gift for the four-year-old construction enthusiast

reviewText: This is a fantastic bedtime book. My 3-year old LOVES to read about how each vehicle work hard all day then get ready for sleeping.

It is hard to believe this book is the writer's first story; wonderful work she did here. It is engaging and suitable for dramatizing. Artwork is wonderful also; you should check out other works of the illustrator. My truck enthusiast preschooler was amazed with the book; both listening to the story and looking at the illustrations. A little pricey but if it gets a price cut, don't miss it.
Such a good book.  For little boys or little girls into big construction vehicles, this is the perfect book choice.

My grandson just loved the book.  He had me read it over and over.  He had so many questions about the pictures and wanted to know a lot about the setting and why things were this way or that.  The prose was great.  I too loved the book.

My 2.5 year old is fascinated with all things construction related: excavators, backhoes, front end loads, bulldozers, etc.  He wears a hard hat around the house, and when we're driving in the car and he spots a bulldozer he wants to stop the car and get out so he can check it out.

Needless to say, we've been buying more construction-themed items lately, and this book just popped up on Amazon the other day so I grabbed it.  Great illustrations, fun story -- good pace for a 2-3 year old.  Nice quality on the binding/pages, too.
summary: Great for toddlers who love construction stuff

reviewText: I bought this book for my almost 5 year old twin nephews.  They love any and every kind of truck and I thought they would like this book about the different trucks.  They now know if they see a crane, or a bulldozer, more than I do.  And it is a wonderful book to read at bedtime.  I am so glad I got it for them.

reviewText: Bought it for my truck and car and anything with wheels obsessed 2 year old, and has become one of his favorites. Unlike some of the hacked together truck books (here's a picture of an excavator, it moves dirt) books that draw his attention and I grudgingly read, this one was actually really well done. It has a great cadence for reading out loud, very comforting and works to get him in the mood for sleep, it's a surprisingly well illustrated, endearing book that we both enjoy. Would definitely recommend.

reviewText: My four year-old son loves this book.  We got it a week ago and he has insisted on it at bedtime every night since.

When a day of hard work is done, the trucks in a construction site stop to rest for the night.  In this unique bedtime story, all of the trucks, from the crane truck to the cement mixer to the dump truck, bulldozer and excavator, stop and rest before another day.  Children ages 3-6 will enjoy seeing all of the different trucks at a construction site, and may even be inspired to go to sleep.
